description: Super awesome espresso macchiato with almond milk. They have hardly any seating inside but I appreciate the grab and go vibe. Their condiment bar is so righteously stocked. They have anything you could want to add to your coffee; raw sugar, brown sugar, splenda, simple syrup, almond milk, you name it. The aesthetic is so cool and minimalistic in this coffee bar. The ready made fridge was closed when we went in. I wasn't sure if it was because we showed up around closing or if it was broken. I didn't get a chance to try their pastries but they looked super amazing. The espresso here is very smooth and bright and reminds me of honey. Was overall a good place to grab a quick high quality espresso.
author: Graesyn H.

description:
FiDi has like a 100 coffee bars in a small 1-mile radius in downtown SF. Coffee Bar is one of five that I walk by every day on my way to work. I've stopped by here a couple of times specially for their Horchata Cold Brew ($5) which is very good. I've also tried their Vietnamese Cold Brew ($4.25) which does not have the intense deep strong sweet taste of coffee that you expect from Vietnamese coffee. I've also tried their cappuccino with both regular and Almond milk and found it to be good but not great. 

Like every other coffee place in FiDi at the peak morning hours expect a rush. Here it becomes a little pronounced as the place is very small and a lot of people end up standing close to the exit almost blocking it. I think they need to do a slightly better job of controlling the line and letting people move outside from where they can pick up their orders. Due to the rush I've not tried their hand crafted (pour over) coffee selection as the wait for that can be pretty long. The cashier and the baristas here are pretty good and treat patrons with respect (most coffee places in FiDi are like that except for Peets). Overall it's a nice place for me to cheat on my regular illy Café once in a while.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
Solid coffee from a small business with a few SF locations. 

There seems to be an infinite amount of coffee shops in the Financial District--from Starbucks, Peet's, Working Girl's Cafe, etc etc. 

I like supporting small businesses mostly because there is something so impersonal about going to big brand coffee shops. Starbucks, for example, uses a bulk matcha mix for their matcha latte, which has sooooo much sugar and milk emulsifiers. Big coffee shops also get packed to the brim with long lines because people like going to places that feel familiar. 

In this infinite sea of the Financial District, I like going to Coffee Bar on Kearny, which is a very small shop. There are seats outside, but the space is too small to have real cafe tables. They offer pre packed take away meals like salad and chia pudding, which is fantastic! 

From a quick internet search, I learned it has a few other larger locations. They also get their beans from Bay Area Coffee House Mr. Espresso. 

Coffee bar is a solid small business coffee shop with great tasting coffee. I've gone here a couple time for lattes, and have enjoyed it so far. The latte is strong and rich, and the perfect pick-me up. 

The space is contemporary and chic, but unpretentious. Hipster coffee places don't have the best sugar stations. I find that the mark of a great coffee shop is if they offer brown sugar for your coffee, which enhances the richness of the coffee unlike white sugar. And Coffee Bar has brown sugar! 

Overall, my favorite FiDi Coffee place so far.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Simple little spot I came across while wandering the city after a workout in the early morning. It was a perfectly misty morning that called for a warm cup of coffee. 

You're greeted by a case of pastries and treats and a friendly but calm and gentle staff. I didn't partake in any pastry items, but I was certainly tempted. Had I not known my company had breakfast waiting for us, I would have indulged. 

My small almond milk latte was a bit steep at $6 after the tip, but when you taste the creamy smooth goodness in a cup and let your eyes appreciate the latte art, you quickly realize that you're enjoying a cup of liquid gold.
author: Taylor S.

description:
I've only been here once, and this rating is for the vanilla latte. It is not good. Way too sweet, couldn't taste anything special, $5 for a small latte, and I didn't even finish it because it didn't taste good. Also had to wait in line for a long time to get coffee and this was like almost 2PM. 

If you like sweet coffee drinks like vanilla / caramel lattes, they taste way better at Illy's.

No comment about their regular coffees.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I was a tad flustered on what to get, but ended up going with the drip coffee the other day, which was pretty good. But, not sure it was worth the price tag of almost $5 :unamused:. Still, it was good, and did the job.

I am very excited to try the Horchata iced coffee soon. I saw someone get it and all the photos on here make me want to try it. It looks so creamy!
author: Fahren F.

description:
I love Starter Baker and love that Coffee Bar carries their goodies. They have amazing kouign amanns and croissants and quiches! 

In terms or coffee, I'm not a huge fan of the beans they use, so I usually come here for lattes or caramel lattes (I usually ask for less syrup) as a treat. It's great for a sleepy afternoon! 

I've had a few of their salads and yogurts and sandwiches before as well and they're all pretty tasty. The salads can be quite expensive (at least $11) and the sandwich will do if you're in a rush for lunch (I believe they have a plain turkey sandwich for about $8). For the yogurt and chia pudding you can choose two toppings (nuts, raisins, granola, etc).
author: Jeanette S.

description: Coffee bar is known for having the best hot chocolate in the Financial and nearby areas but their chai should also be appreciated. Spicy and delicious with enough heat to help you face the afternoon grind. Enjoy!
author: Bill Y.

description:
I had been wanting to come here for a while, and finally got the push to go out of my way and drop in here after winning a gift card to Coffee Bar at a work event.  Total win, right?! 

Well maybe my expectations were too high, but my decaf almond milk latte wasn't that special...and it actually wasn't that good.  It was barely hot, which I could've dealt with had it not been so sweet.  

Why, oh why do these coffee shops need to use sweetened almond milk? I don't get it.  Not everyone likes the taste of sugar in everything.  Think of it as a math problem: you can always add (+) in sugar if you want but you can't subtract (-) it from a drink! (totally trademarking that and making an infographic for reference).  

Overall not impressed and sort of bummed out. I'll hold on to the remaining $15 balance on my gift card until they offer unsweetened, non-soy, plant based milk alternatives (that sounds so pretentious but I mean it in the most sincere form) or else I'll give it away to a friend.
author: Tina A.

description:
Coffee Bar's original venue in SoMa is already fantastic as it is, so I was delighted to see that they'd opened shop in the heart of FiDi. It's certainly a more high-volume place than the SoMa original, and depending on how long you can wait, you can either go for drip coffee, espresso drinks, or pour-overs, all using high-quality beans. There's also a good selection of pastries and baked goods from Oakland's fabulous Starter Bakery and from the West Bay's Tout Sweet. 

There isn't a whole lot of room to lounge around, but there are a few makeshift chairs outside. Or, get your drinks to go and enjoy them at an outdoor plaza, or take them back to your office.
author: Vincent L.

description:
My favorite Vanilla Latte in SF!

I prefer Philz for drip but if you're going with a latte, Coffee Bar is incredible and the homemade syrup in addition to the snacks including hard boiled eggs, make it a great spot!
author: Michelle K.

description: I love coffee bar I have made this a regular stop in the morning. The coffee is delicious and the customer service is top notch. Ali is such a sweet barista and always puts a smile on my face in the morning.
author: Olivia C.

description:
LOVE LETTER FROM ME TO COFFEE BAR  
Words cannot describe how much i love your latte. I am definetely addicted. Your latte gives me an indescribable feeling that no other coffee shop has ever given me. Thank you for delivering the best latte in the world. 
P/s: I do not mind walking all the way from my office- a few blocks away just to get your latte. Mwah mwah mwah
author: Nikki T.

description: Omg I can't believe I have finally found a place that my boyfriend approves of. This is the first time we've been able to find a cappuccino made with coffee delicious as ones from France and Israel. I had a capp with Oat milk and it was divine. Don't stop serving this delicious coffee! So glad we went here instead of Pete's! Can't wait to come back. Staff was super friendly and loved the setup of the store.
author: Michelle G.

description:
New coffee shop obsession for the next few months! 

I love their menu. People here are kind and friendly! Cashier has a really cool accent. Actually, she was just plain cool haha. Thanks for spelling my name correctly without me even saying anything. I know Dianna isn't typically spelled with two n's, but it made me happy. It's the little things in life y'all. 

Barista dude was pretty awesome about explaining what was in the dranks. 

Horchata latte is where it's at apparently. I got a cap, but my co-worker opt for the Havana (like a Viet coffee but lighter in sweetness). She accidentally got someone else's horchata lol, but she got to keep it. We were sorry for stealing someone else's drink. So glad this is just across the street from my building! Well it's around the corner, then across the way. 

I'll be coming back!
author: Dianna C.

description:
This place makes me fall in love with my one true love (coffee) more and more every time. Coffee Bar is indefinitely my favorite coffee place in the Bay Area. With it's handcrafted and selective coffee brews, you can close your eyes and point at the menu to select which coffee to get and you won't be disappointed - I'M SERIOUS. 

This is one of my favorite locations aside from their original place on Bryant St. because it's in the FiDi. The place is much smaller than their other locations, but you're really just there for the coffee (pastries too). I haven't encountered horrible service at this location and the people who work here are always energetic and welcoming. The coffee selection is great, as I mentioned before. It's delicious, strong, and the service is impeccably fast - take that Starbucks!  They also serve delicious pastries AND my favorite cookies of all time, Anthony's Cookies!

Some of my favorite/must try drinks are:

Vietnamese Iced Cold Brew (really strong, I suggest to ask for light ice - they are totally cool about it too!)
Havana Latte (soooooo good)
Cortado
Almond Milk Latte 
Horchata Cold Brew
author: Victoria K.

description: This is the first time I have ever appreciated the subtlety of cold brew.  Really delicious. The cashier seemed exasperated by my 20 sec to pick a pastry. That was good too though.
author: Danielle B.

description: I always visit Coffee Bar whenever I'm tired of the coffee in our office. The cafe is fairly small, so it can be a bit cramped whenever there's a rush. Service here is always amazing -- the baristas are very nice and they always have a smile on their face. My go-to drinks are the Horchata Iced Coffee and the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Overall, I highly recommend. :)
author: Randall O.

description:
Hey, I just ordered a short americano and it's really quite good. 

The cashier wasn't sure what a 'short americano' was, and to be honest I don't even know if it's the correct term, but she asked for clarification which I really appreciated. 

(Americano with less water / 1:1 water : espresso ratio). 

Usually don't write yelp reviews but thought ya'll would appreciate it. 
Blue Bottle got bought buy Nestle and and I try not to support Nestle so you guys got my business now.
author: Wilson N.

description:
One of my favorite coffee shops! I love their iced caramel latte (12oz). I'm definitely a coffee lover, but not up to get their 16oz just cause the 12oz takes me all morning to finish. Their coffee gives me life in the morning and afternoon - it's an energy booster in my book.

So the location is in the middle of financial district. It's a bit squishy, like the place is so small that maybe only 10 comfortably can fit in there. So if you're looking at coffee bar, order on the right and pick up on the left. For those new in the area, please do not block the doorways. Wait outside for your drink. They have a few chairs and side tables outside to sit. For those who are on the go, they have coffee for $2. Just bring cash. 

Here's how you do that:
Bring $2, get a cup 12oz or 16oz, and get your coffee!

It's that simple! Staff is always great! You'll see the same group almost everyday. I like how they get to know regulars and know exactly what they want before they step up to order. Great customer service!
author: Tina M.

description:
It's Friday and decided to give something other than my normal cafe a try. This place is a block away from my office. There is always a small line out the door. The place is nice and clean. They have a many selection of milk and sugar you can use for your coffee. They have almond milk, that's a nice touch. 

But the coffee...I'm sorry but I guess I'm a coffee slob but the coffee just isn't that good. And the prices isn't cheap. I got the americano and I think it was actually kinda tasteless. I was hoping for something stronger in taste and caffeinated. I guess if you want someone to make you a pretty coffee, this is one of the many places in the FIDI that can do that. But I think you get better coffee and coffee art at Blue Bottle down the block. Same prices. Just my opinion. 

Also got their Nutella Brioche Bun. It's actually really good but I had to come back to my office to heat it up. Shouldn't it be heated for me? To me coffee bar is average coffee cafe in the FIDI. Nothing special.
author: Sandy B.

description:
The horchata cold brew is a must try!  Even if the line is long during the morning rush, the cold brew will come out almost immediately.  It's sweet, creamy, and has all the flavors you'd expect in horchata.  I actually love this drink so much that I can't seem to order anything else!

Location is close to Montgomery Bart station which is convenient, but there's often a bit of traffic in and outside the store.  Can be hard to find a spot to wait for your drink to be called out.  This is not a place to come and hang out at - there's no seating.  

They've got some (pricey, but probably good) breakfast options that you can pick up to go with your coffee.  Good service, the cashiers have been friendly every time I've been!
author: Kenna H.

description: This is my go-to coffee spot when I'm in the city. No nonsense setup just grab your joe and go. I love the vanilla latte they make it creamy with just the right amount of sweetness.
author: Sundeep G.

description:
Oh man! I just fell in head-over-heels love... with Horchata cold brew. I don't mind the consistent 10 minute wait. I could care less about the crowded space. I would put up with so much worse to have that sweet, milky, cinnamony cold brew coffee. It is perfection in a cup.

Also the Havana latte is quite delicious. Their almond milk lattes are legit too. So... basically every coffee drink I've tried here is on point. I love the convenience of really tasty coffee being just a short walk from the Montgomery St bart station. They use beans from local Mr. Espresso. There are seats to hang out on while you sip your caffeine treat and watch all the FiDi people rush by. They offer pastries and Straus yogurt (with toppings) if you are in need of a quick breakfast too. Overall, this is a great little coffee bar in the FiDi.
author: Jennifer B.

description: There are plenty of good coffee places in the Financial District, and this is definitely one of them! Their seating is limited, but the drinks are excellent. For a change of pace, check out their Havana Latte!
author: Ed M.

description: Hands down best coffee spot in FiDi. I've been enjoying Americanos and Vanilla Lattes here for years and am now thoroughly spoiled by their quality. The vanilla latte tastes like a melted marshmallow - I promise you will not find another this delicious! The staff are also the best and always great to chat with as a start to my morning.
author: Jaime L.

description: Fast and good and hot. What else you want in a place called Coffee Bar. Get in line, get the goods, get out. No lavender massage teas with a chai back. Coffee.  Want a seat?  Try the dirty boulevard in front. Tables and chairs help. It's coffee.
author: Hay S.

description: This is my favorite place to grab a latte in FiDi. Depending on what time you go, there will be a line but it moves relatively quick. My go-to order is the havana latte (half sweet) with almond/soy milk (+$0.75). SO good and it's a nice treat! I always opt for half sweet because the regular is a bit too much sugar for me in the morning. The horchata latte and cold brew are also pretty good! If you are in the mood for tea, their green tea is one of my favorites. There's some seating outside but not a good place to have a comfy sit down meeting or to get any work done. Great coffee shop but a bit on the pricier side for a latte. Overall, coffee bar is one of my top 3 coffee shops in the area, which is saying a lot considering the abundant amount of options on each block :)
author: Mandi H.

description:
I've worked in FiDi for around 6 months, and because I'm coffee obsessed, I've tried almost all of the coffee shops in this area. Coffee Bar has the best coffee blend I can find--if you like chocolatey, nutty flavored coffee as opposed to the bitter, acidic coffee taste that is popular in many shops, you should be sure to visit. They have the best regular cold brew I've tried, and it tastes great black. If you like sweet coffee or are in the mood for a treat, the horchata cold brew is perfect--creamy and just the right amount of cinnamon flavor and sweetness to brighten your day. The only thing I wish is that they made a dairy free version, so that vegans or people on dairy free diets can also enjoy!

Aside from the coffee, I've interacted with three different baristas and they're all extremely friendly and welcoming. There's often the hustle and bustle of the working crowd in the morning, but their service is quick. I've only tried one food item--the chia seed pudding, and it's a perfect blend of almond milk, chia seeds, and vanilla and is a perfect breakfast option. Don't let the tiny storefront and small space deter you--step into Coffee Bar and let them help you out :)
author: G P.

description:
The vanilla latte is very good and I liked it. Positive first experience so I'll definitely be back. Additionally, the layout of this store is very neatly organized. This certainly gives customers a notable impression of accuracy, efficiency and simplicity. One of the best coffee shops I've patronized.

Key points for this rating:
- friendly staff members (+1)
- clean facility (+1)
- good service (+1)
- delicious coffee beverages (+1)
- outdoor seating available (+1)
author: Bennett W.

description:
When you work in FiDi and there's seriously 7 different coffee shops on the same block, how do you choose?

You listen to people who tell you to choose Coffee Bar. Even though theres always a line out the door, they're quick because they have friendly and efficient baristas who know you're rushing to get to work.  Each beverage is made with such detail. Their Havana Latte(latte sweetened with condensed milk) is my favorite.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Coffee Bar has three locations, one in Upper Mission and two in FiDi (less than a quarter mile apart). They're famous for their Havana Latte (condensed milk and espresso) and Vietnamese Iced Coffee (espresso with their house cold brew)and have a cult following also for their extra spicy chai latte.

* HAVANNA LATTE ($4?) - 4.5 STARS:
Espresso, milk, and condensed milk. Tastes like heaven. 

* CHAI LATTE ($4+) - 4.5 STARS: 
Comes in two sizes (12 and 16 oz I believe), offered with regular, non-fat, soy, or almond milk - soy and almond both slightly sweetened. It's equal parts Bhakti Original Chai liquid concentrate (bhakti.com) and steamed milk - rich, sweet, creamy and extra spicy! It was so good, I tried to find a grocery to buy the unsweetened version, but only found it available at Whole Foods SOMA (original version) or bottled and premixed (Rainbow Grocery). I wish it was less sweet, even with "less chai" it was too sweet for my taste. 

You can order the liquid concentrate, dry tea bags, or pre-mixed bottles online - but shipping was $15, ouch. You can also find several cafes and a few grocers in the SF area selling Bhakti (likely the Original Flavor) - http://bhaktichai.com/find-bhakti/. Guess Coffee Bar has a new loyal follower.

A bit pricey ($4+ for a regular sized latte - there is an "SF Fee" charged on top of all purchases), but delicious. No wonder there is always a line!

They have some pre-packed salads and a variety of pastries including Anthony's cookies!
author: Jess C.

description:
Flew into SFO, checked into The Galleria, and then was in need of immediate caffeination.  

Where to go?  Yelp directed me here.  

And, I'm so glad it did.  I ordered my usual mocha and was pleasantly surprised.  High quality espresso paired with high quality chocolate?  An unbeatable combination.  The service was friendly, if a bit slow.  I don't mind waiting a bit for a well crafted cup of deliciousness, but something to think about if you're short on time (there wasn't much of a line and it took 10-15 minutes for my order).  

The latte art was commendable--when the barista finished my mocha and called me over, he began to hand me my cup and then said, "Wait...can I get a picture of that?", and took a quick pic of his art.  I love a barista who takes pride in his work.

Get to it!
author: Ophelia M.

description:
Damn. There's a reason the line for this place is out the door in the AM.  In my continual quest for the FiDi's best (almond milk) latte, Coffee Bar has been on my to-do list for a very long time.  I finally plucked up the courage to take the 4 block walk to find the line almost to the sidewalk.  

Things move fairly quickly here, and could move even faster if you know about the $2 pour-your-own coffee option up at the counter.  Yep, drop $2 into the pitcher, pour yourself the coffee from the thermos, and be on your way. That being said, if you're like me and need the espresso option, you'll have to find a good place to stand and wait once you order.  

I'm currently avoiding dairy (it's a Paleo thing), so needing almond milk was essential.  I ordered the latte with almond milk (from Califa), which set me back $4.40.  Yeah, I know what you're thinking, "why would anyone pay that much for a cup of almond milk and espresso?" My answer: Research my friends, research.  And a good research expense it was.  Coffee Bar served up a rich, thick, and hearty latte, and it warmed my soul.  I wish this place was closer, but at $4.40 a cup, I'm also a little glad it's far away.  What's the saying? Absence makes the heart grow fonder?  Till next time Coffee Bar and your delicious and frothy latte, I will continue to pine for thee.
author: Lisa I.

description:
The ambiance is a medium sized coffee bar. At morning rush hours, Coffee Bar is usually packed with people waiting inside to indulge on some caffeine. Lines for ordering usually are out the door. The wait time isn't too bad, about 5-10 minutes before your order is made (unless if you get an iced beverage)! :)

I really enjoy the lattes here and that's what I would typically order. However, this time o got a sample of the Horchata cold-brewed. It was so AMAZING,with the perfect hint of cinnamon and vanilla! I love love love this ice beverage..but it comes out to be pretty pricey at $5.60 a pop! The only sad thing I have a bit to complain was the price. As a result, this shall only be a specialty treat once in a awhile :o
author: Sally N.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of this place! I've tried their iced Vietnamese coffee and iced Havana latte. 

The Vietnamese coffee is strong - just the way I like it. What attracted me to try the Havana latte is the fact that it's sweetened with condensed milk. The latte had a very interesting taste - interesting in a good way. Love it! 

This is my go to spot every time I'm craving a special cup of coffee.
author: Michelle T.

description:
My boss introduced me to Coffee Bar a week and a half ago. She told me "Starbucks and Pete's are for old people" and that "all the cute start-up boys hangout here". Being perfectly comfortable with my relationship status, I laughed. However, the coffee was definitely n times better than any cup I've had at Starbucks and Pete's, so as a result, I've come here 3 times since. I don't plan on disappearing anytime soon. It's literally a 5 minute walk from where I work. 

I've had the Havana Latte twice. I tried the Mocha Recchiuti today. You definitely don't need to add any sugar to the Havana Latte (it's sweet and probably extremely fattening, but also the best thing ever if you like sweet coffee -- without being overly sweet). The Mocha Recchiuti is a bit more bitter. The Mocha Recchiuti is also extremely strong, you feel energized the minute you drink it. Pretty sure I won't be able to sleep tonight! They also do cute little hearts, and other designs with the cream, you know, typical of the hipster coffee house. 

The only seating is outside, and I don't recommend planning on doing work here. I checked for WiFi and they have a network, but I think you have to ask for the password (it wasn't posted anywhere). It's a place to quickly meet up for coffee and chat.
author: Deepti N.

description:
I was drinking a lackluster latte from Starbucks in my office one day (I'm not a coffee snob--I love Starbucks, Joe Sixpack), when a co-worker asked if I'd tried Coffee Bar yet.  I hadn't.  So one morning when I was feeling adventurous, I decided to switch up my game and get my caffeine fix from CB instead of Starbucks.  SO glad I did!

I love, love, love CB!  They've managed to perfect the art of liquid motivation.  The coffee is very strong, so if you are tired in the morning, or crashing around 3 p.m., this is the perfect place to get your groove started or get your groove back. Got deadlines?  Coffee Bar.  

I used to get the Vietnamese Iced Coffee all of the time, which is still my favorite because it's very strong yet tastes divine, but I think it has too many calories for my taste (and waist).  I switched to a small Havana latte with nonfat milk, which also does the trick quite well and tastes great!  CB also does a drip coffee that is immensely popular.  Likewise, they have an honor coffee system, where you can pour yourself a cup of coffee and leave your money in the jar.  

I love the people that work here--they are always friendly and smiling.  It is such a pleasure when people enjoy their job.  I asked one of the baristas how he is always in such a good mood the other day, and he told me CB is a pretty chill place to work.  Love that.  In addition, there are always a ton of people working so your order comes out with a quickness.  They always put a little heart in the foam on my latte--nice touch!  

I note that they have pretty good-lookin' food options, although I haven't gotten around to trying anything yet.  They have yogurt with granola, sandwiches, and salads.  They also have pastry if you're into pastry--I think the cheddar scone looks kind of dope.  Again, I haven't tried anything because I am perpetually on a diet.  

This place is insane in the morning, so lookout.  I try to come around lunch so I'm taken care of throughout the afternoon.   If you come after 2:00 p.m., you might not be able to fall asleep later on in the evening, just so you know.  

That's all she wrote!
author: Sunny S.

description:
First thing first - the coffee is amazing - based on the coffee alone they would get five stars! I've long been a fan of Recchiuti chocolate so when the boss mentioned that they have a Recchiuti Mocha, I was sold...and then I actually tried it and I was hooked. The place itself is very small, and usually packed. The people that work there have the largest chips on their shoulders - it's like they're doing you a favor by deigning to look at you and taking your order...call me crazy but when I order a small cup of coffee for $6, I expect better service! But you know what, I liked the coffee enough that I dealt with their crap-don't-stink attitude - until today.

I waited in a line that was out the door, when I was almost at the register one of the guys behind the bar asked me for my order which I gave to him. He didn't take my name. I finally paid and stepped aside to wait for my coffee with the rest of the pack waiting for their coffee. The guy behind the bar says "your drink is ready" - just that, to a group of six or seven people. And then he repeats it, same thing "your drink is ready" - so I asked him if he was talking to me. He said yes and then under his breath "I've only said it five times" - hey, here's a couple of tips - 1) ask for a name when you take the order 2) when you say that someone's drink is up, say what the drink is 3) maybe, and this is a radical idea, make eye contact with the person whose drink is ready so they know you're talking to them and lastly keep your smarmy comments to yourself. 

I pass six coffee places between Bart and my office and going forward I will be patronizing the other five. I'm sure my small $6 drink makes no difference to their bottom line but it makes a difference to how I start my day by going someplace where I'm going to get a smile with my coffee, or at the very least going someplace where I don't get a crap ton of attitude with my coffee.
author: Debbie B.

description: pretty sweet little coffee shop. super nice folks hand brew starts at 8. nice pastry selection (not just your average bagel)
author: Whitni F.

description:
Hidden from public site because it is located within the confines within one of the financial buildings in financial district, Coffee Bar's main customers are going to be business people, of course. 

Modern, hole-in-the-building kind of coffee shop that serves strongly roasted coffee and imprints their white cups with a coffee bar stamp!  Simple menu with side snacks and bakery goods offered. Few outside seating, which makes it a cozy caffe!

It's crowded when the morning rush to work is happening!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
There are many things I am and many things I'm not...a coffee connoisseur I would say is one of them (not being).  I can't do black coffee, and I'm picky.  Sometimes I feel like a "cheap date" with liking McDonald's iced coffee.  I usually prefer Starbucks and when I am near one, Philz.  I decided to head to Coffee Bar after stopping by a nearby client's office.  

I stopped in last Tuesday right before 10:30AM.  There were still a handful of people getting coffee.  It was a hard choice between the usually strong iced Vietnamese coffee and the Caramel Latte, but I chose the Caramel Latte.  It was 12 oz. for $4.25, a little pricey indeed.  After about five minutes or so, my coffee was ready and I took the first sip..first sip had a little bite but it was good.  Second sips and beyond..OMGG..best latte ever!  It was very well balanced, not too sweet, but not bitter at all and not "strong" tasting.  It did give me a teeny bit of a buzz after I finished. 

Will definitely be back when I'm around that area of FiDi.  They had a good assortment of drinks, without having a huge list like the corporate coffeehouses.  They also have a $3 Paypal credit on the Paypal app for anyone that wants to save a little moola.  Wish they would open a third location closer to my office!
author: Cat C.

description:
Good,coffee, crappy customer service.  I ordered a pastry this morning (a kouign amman, really good).  The hipster checking me out commented what an expensive pastry it was, I told him I that agreed, especially since he was charging me more than the sign said.  His response? "Well that's not what is says in the computer." He took away the sign, and didn't offer to charge me the advertised price. Maybe if he had a better attitude he would be buying expensive pastries rather than ringing them up for other people.

Side note - Coffee Bar gets their yummy pastries from Starter Bakery.  If you work in the FIDI and would like to enjoy them without the attitude, try Reveille Coffee or Paramo Coffee.
author: Nicole G.

description:
With an abundance of coffee shops in FiDi, I can never understand why there is a line at this place in the mornings. I don't get some swanky latte or some off the top creation (nor do those in front of me, from my experience)....so why!? Is it because the coffee is individually dripped? word, but aint nobody got time. Are the beans organically grown in Portland and picked by vegan children in ironic t-shirts? Fantastic, I don't care.

While I'm no coffee elitist, I am picky about my coffee..... maybe just tad under a snob. When the morning coffee fix is needed and there is more than two people in line, I'll go out of my way to peets for a similar coffee expreience for less money with less judgmental stares as im decked out in my yuppie-wear.

Your coffee aint bad, but you aint good. Keep it moving.
author: Ryan L.

description:
LOVE the coffee here. I'm not super picky about coffee, but I know a good cup of coffee when I see one. I moved back to the city recently and wanted to try some good coffee spots, which I know SF has plenty of. The first time I came here, I got a regular latte and was really impressed by the flavor. A solid cup of coffee. I've also tried their havana latte, and it's as good as people say! I might be biased because I love condensed milk though. 

Coffee Bar has become one of my favorite spots for coffee, and I'll be frequenting it a lot more for my morning coffee needs.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Come here for a no frills coffee. Slightly above average quality. Some food available but looks rather expensive (from a visitor perspective, at least). Very limited outdoor seating. No guest wifi.
author: Joshua T.

description:
THEE best coffee. Yummy, strong, fast.
This was my go to place when in the FiDi. Everyone is super friendly, and get you your coffee to be on your way. So sad I moved out of the bay, every time I drink a cup of coffee I will pretend it is Coffee Bar quad caramel latte. Cuts the sweetness and mama certified for those mornings preceeded by sleepless nights. Yee!
author: Nani B.

description:
You will walk out pleased. I think they've got decent baristas, as well as beans. It was how I expect espresso style coffee to be served.

It was a standard decore/ fitout, more somewhere I would pick up my coffee to go, opposed to have in. The staff were also friendly. Would be happy to make a regular coffee location.
author: Kristine B.

description:
Hands down the best caramel latte I have ever had. I love how you can taste the burnt caramel flavor and instead of the artificial syrup flavor that is so common every where else. Also really enjoyed the vietnamese coffee- loved so much that I bought a whole bottle to go. 

I love the atmosphere of this place. Definitely worth a try if you're around the FiDi area!
author: Tram N.

description:
I just find it audacious that the owners of Coffee Bar would attempt to set up a lounge on what is arguably the busiest block in the FiDi. After all, we're not in Italy where there would be six cafes in a row with bulbous waiters in starched white shirts with their little mustaches and their little silver trays. No, this is the heart of the San Francisco business area where everything has to be on the go and out of my way - or out of somebody's way since my battle-scarred shoulders have a higher incidence of grazing and shoving on this stretch of pavement than any other in the city - including Chinatown on Saturday mornings. But you can actually sit down and have your coffee here as you watch people who make more money than you flash you a patronizing glare of disdain.

What a treat when you happen to want to take a break before a meeting you dread back in the office. And the coffee is smooth and robust enough to enjoy while you've parked your derriere. For $4, you can get a rich, nice-afternoon-size Vanilla, Caramel or Havana Latte, the latter quite alluring with less of the requisite sweetness. But for $3.50, a large cup of their drip coffee satisfies me just fine even if it's nearly twice the price of what I could get at Starbucks. Coffee Bar's beans are sourced not from some Brazilian rain forest plantation or some Italian hilltop monastery but from a local roaster named Mr. Espresso which I previously knew as the roaster you see outside the window of any East Bay-bound BART train lurching toward the next stop. Really good stuff with pastries if you are so inclined.

COFFEE -  4 stars...the Mr. Espresso drip is quite the afternoon antidote for a stressful work day
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...a very modern set-up inside, a mini-lounge on the outside
SERVICE - 4 stars...quick and attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...smooth cup of caffeine beckons you here
author: Ed U.

description:
I seriously feel like my heart is going to leap out of my chest and grab my drink to-go.

My heart is racing, and I know that it's not just because of the iced Vietnamese coffee I just ordered.

It's because I'm here with my coworker, with those stunning blue eyes.

I'm so nervous that even with the coffee, I can barely get two sentences out. I sound slow, and just slightly more entertaining than an automated check out machine.

Blue eyes is speaking to me about some architecture across the street, and all I can do is nod, and think of clever things in my head that never translate into real words.

We sit on the bench outside, for only about 5 minutes because I am just that dull.

Slightly above catatonic on the outside, but on the inside my heart and mind are racing.

I want to strike up a conversation, but I'm way too shy.

Then our coworker Mon comes by and her and blue eyes talk about the different pizza places around.

And I'm standing around like a statue, then I'm just slightly walking behind them as they head back to the office, chatting amongst themselves.
author: Jack R.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this coffee bar out. I still prefer their other location because the lines here get way too unwieldy, but that being said, they also know how to handle this line better. Here they actually take your order when you're waiting in line and they have a lot more baristas at work. Would give this place a five-star rating but I'll leave it at a four since I think the lines are better at the other location. 

Same good coffee as their other location--I love the Caramel latte--though I can never tell if it's the latte or the caramel syrup that makes theirs so good, but it's definitely my favorite caramel latte out of all of the places that I've been to. Croissants here are also pretty good!

tldr; same great Coffee Bar lattes, but lines are worse since this one is literally in the heart of FiDi
author: Jasmine X.

description:
You can't go wrong with ordering havana latte! It's good either iced of hot. I get mine with soy and it's delicious!

The Vietnamese iced coffee is good too! It's not as strong as the normal Vietnamese coffee.

Some of my coworkers think their lattes are too sweet but the baristas are able to make the lattes less sweet.

I LOVE their latte art!
author: Alice X.

description:
The Havana Latte is amazinggg. & I'm super glad there's 2 locations in FiDi! =)

This place may not top the Mission District location, but it serves its purpose for the location & size. I'm not much of a coffee person either. I always feel that Peet's or Starbucks tastes too bland & other coffee shops just taste too strong. However, coffee bar is spot on. 

Must try's at this place are:
-Havana Latte
-Vanilla Latte
-Cobb Salad
-Quinoa Salad & the Salmon Topper
-Ham & Cheese Pop Tart
-Almond Croissant
-Iced Tea

Also, if you're on the go and just want some really quick coffee, they have a self serve area where you put $2 in a jar and then just serve the coffee yourself.
author: Wendy L.

description:
OK, want to play a little game? Here we go: the first person to tell me what's better than a cup of java served with a warm smile and a delicious Anthony's cookie as a little late afternoon snack will score free butterfly kisses for a year.

Hint: my eyelashes will never touch your cheek, because it's not possible.
author: Ruggy J.

description: A simple review for a simple cup of coffee.  But my god that coffee was good.  Truly delicious brew, nice environment, clean easy and fast.  And reasonably priced.  Excellent!
author: Scott H.

description:
Tried their latte, mocha, cappuccino and Vietnamese iced coffee. Havana latte was a bit sweet for me, mocha was rich but I usually only get it once in a while. Cappuccino was good, not very strong for me though :/ Vietnamese iced coffee is slightly on the sweet side, but tasty and the caffeine serves me well. Then it becomes my go to drink.

Also when I'm in a hurry and there's a long line in the morning on a weekday, Vietnamese iced coffee comes right on.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Okay, seriously. This is probably my favorite place in all of FiDi to get coffee. Why? you ask. Two words: Havana Latte.

This isn't exactly on the way to work for me, so coming to Coffee Bar is a huge treat for me!

Pros:
- Taste: Not watered down 
- Menu: They have tea, drip coffee, and lattes on lattes on lattes..
- Baked Goods: A bit on the pricey side, but still yummy - Feta/Spinach Croissants were soooo yummy!
- Service: Regardless of the line, the people here are super friendly and patient. Especially if you don't know what to order
- Consistently good coffee...not hit or miss like Starbucks.

Cons: 
- A bit on the pricey side..but thats also because I get lattes. And they're fancy like that...
- It isn't on the way (for me)..haha, can't really count this against them

All in all..loveeeee this place and thats why, 5 stars from me!!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Not a very efficient setup. I know this is a small place, but there is something going on at every section of Coffee Bar. One part of the counter is for ordering, next to the refrigerated foods section. Another is for picking up drinks. Another is grab-n-go coffee. The back table is for lids, creamers, etc. It's just chaotic. 

I like that they have Vietnamese coffee! This was the one special thing that definitely stood out. I prefer to feel less hectic when getting coffee (since I'm already needing coffee) but if you are fine with this sort of environment, it's totally a convenient place to go.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I really really really like their lattes. The smooth steamed milk crashed into the perfected dripped espresso shot and topped off with a cute latte art. Yowzah!!!

People here are friendly. limited seating area, more of a grab and go place. They have a grab your own coffee kind of thing, where you pour your own coffee and drop 2 dollars into the jar. Honor system!

It is a tad pricey, so I come here on Fridays for the treat I think I deserve! =P Also! I tried the Havana Latte, not bad at all either! Might be a tad sweet, but nice and strong!
author: Judy W.

description:
Solid spot for a delicious cup of coffee or frothy latte.

Expect a decent wait if you're strolling in the a.m. during a work day.  

Large vanilla latte and a pastry, expect to pay about $8 

Service was quick and attentive, but due to the staffing vs. number of patrons.. it's still a bit slow.  But it seems like they are doing their best!  So I'm not going to complain about it.

There's not really a place to sit and enjoy your coffee/do some work.  More of a grab and go.

Overall, I can say I'm a fan :)
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Havana Latte ($4.25): perfectly balanced flavors of coffee and condensed milk. LOVE.

I also got the Mushroom Pesto & Brie Popover ($4.45) and that was delish. It's loaded with button mushroom halves and savory flavor. The edges were heavily sprinkled with black & white sesame seeds in which I felt it could do without; they added a crunch, but *shrug*. 

They are also quite efficient for the FiDi morning rush, but I'd still allow for 10-15 minutes buffer on top of where you need to be. There's only so much they can do when the line is out the door. :)
author: Kathleen N.

description:
Yummy!
Mochas with Giuttard chocolate- rich and creamy and just the right temperature.
Their Neopolitan blend is supreme-
Also a couple of minutes walking from the Montgomery street Bart station.
Would return for my caffeine fix!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
It's about $3.75 for the delicious, smaller sized latte. They also offer a pretty cool, prepackaged yogurt bar, along with some random quinoa salads, and assorted pastries (none of which I've tried - strictly a beverage girl). Oh, and self serve coffee for $2, which I've never done either. LATTES ONLY, for me! 

I come in on my way to work and always expect there to be about a 10 minute wait. It's weird because it looks like there's not a lot of people in line, and after you order and wait for your drink to come up, people appear out of thin air who were apparently before you in line. So yeah, look are deceiving - be prepared to wait a little bit. It's worth it though.

And there's also a location on Kearny a couple of blocks up towards Chinatown! It's a bigger store.
author: Angela L.

description:
Running on empty? Stop by the Coffee Bar to fill yourself up and prep for the rest of your day! 

So after a long morning in court (for work...don't judge...[judge...get it? I crack myself up])  I was devolving into a sloth. Thankfully my friend suggested a meet up at the Coffee Bar. Soon I was back up to 100% with caffeine and pastries running through my veins! 

The delicious chai tea quickly made me ready to tackle yet another court appearance in the afternoon. On top of that I saw a scone that made me double take. Maple, apple & BACON!! Oh yeah, that had to happen. Utter bliss. All for ~$7. 

Now I know where I'll head if I have to wake up!!
author: Eli Y.

description:
My kind of bar! [insert winky emoji here]

This is a great place to grab a quick cup of coffee (with a slight artistic/hipster-y vibe), while in the Financial District.

I tried the drip coffee and, for a $2 small, you can get a good coffee! I wouldn't go as far to say that it is the "best" coffee that I've ever had, but it did not disappoint!

The customer service was attentive and nice and the inside was very clean and light. They also offer almond milk as a free option at the milk/cream station, if you're into that. I take my coffee black, but hey! Almond milk!
author: Gabriela K.

description: The drinks here are super good and full of flavor. I got the Vietnamese style iced coffee and it was really creamy and tasty but maybe a tad bit too sweet. They also put two shots of espresso in each drink. Would recommend!
author: Cindy B.

description:
This review is for their customer service and wait time.

I understand coffee shop rush hour times between 8am-9am are at it's peak everywhere in this area but their assembly line drink process needs a tune up. There is no reason someone should wait 30 mins for 1 Small Havana Latte, I mean it's not like we have to go back to work or anything, right?  After reminding the Baristas 3x that I have been waiting in line over 25+ mins for my drink they just kept saying we will make it for you, excellent customer service would have been- "Let me put this ahead of the line for you, because I've seen you standing in front of me for almost a half hour." 

I am not one to write negative reviews but if this review is read by any management I recommend you take a look at your customer service at this location. Coffee is coffee. It's the same everywhere, but what sets you apart is the consumer experience. When you are competing with the level that Philz and Blue Bottle is on, you need to make sure that the consumers experience in your shop should be first class.
author: Alexa H.

description: I wanted to love this place. I am enamored with Coffee Bar in the Mission. But I have to be honest, the espresso here just isn't as good. Still, it is a better place to go for straight coffee or basic espresso drinks than, say, Starbucks. Not bad for a quick coffee fix.
author: Brian B.

description:
Coffee without the wait.  As with most people, when I want coffee I want it quickly, to taste good and strong (usually with 3+ shots of espresso).

My go to is usually a red eye (double red eye 'insert assorted names for that here) with dark roast.

I decided to go out of the usual comfort zone and try something new.  A friend told us about this place and I'm a little upset we spent so many trips to BB (hopefully SFers will know what that is) and wait for 30min.

Havana Latte.  I'd recommend that... for the restaurant to only offer that... ever.  What is it you ask?  Why, let me describe it to you.

Take a cloud.  Gently warm it with a hint of steam.  Flavor it with coffee.  Give it a touch of sweetness.  There you go.

It's essentially a latte (two shots of espresso and milk) except they substitute sweetened condensed milk or the regular ole' cow juice. 

It's light and frothy with just the right amount of sweetness.

The line system is a bit confusing when waiting in that there's sometimes little space to stand where you're actually out of someone's way, but the staff and other patrons were all relatively civil
and went on about their way once they received their tithe.

Go there.  Havana Latte.  Nuff said.
author: Dan H.

description:
Your coffee shop
Great coffee, consistent.
Also have other types of coffee for someone more adventure (Vietnamese Coffee, etc...)

Not a lot of room for sitting, there are some benches outside, but we usually grab and go so its all good.
author: Albert C.

description: great tasting coffee in FiDi. staff is friendly and helpful. I'm dying to try the Havana Latte (strong sweetened coffee with condensed milk) but would have to skip lunch and hit the treadmill after. the drip and espresso coffees are outstanding. my regular place whenever I'm in the area. prices are normal
author: Bob U.

description: Had the Havana Latte.  I guess I'm not an expert in how exactly they're supposed to taste, but I liked this one.  Definitely plan to come back.
author: K. B.

description: I went here for a coffee chat and it was really clean and minimalistic! The coffee was pretty good. I ordered an espresso and enjoyed it. It was a little pricey, but def worth coming especially for a quick pick-me-up.
author: Annie W.

description: Best Americano I had while visiting SF this week. And super friendly staff! What's more, they are open very early and perfect for the post-Equinox workout coffee!
author: Mike L.

description: Staff is so friendly. Best coffee for the money in FiDi and my go to coffee spot when I worked on Montgomery.
author: Parker W.

description: You wouldn't know by looking at it, but this is the best drip coffee in the motherf*cking city.
author: Chris R.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. When I wake up, I am a useless zombie. But after their delicious and potent cold brew, I am ready to face the day. It brings me great happiness! Thanks coffee bar!
author: Ben G.

description:
The havana latte is probably a bazillion calories but it's sooooo hard to care when it's soooooo delicious. I think they use Mr. Espresso for their beans, and I've heard it said that their quality of the beans isn't "the best" but again, I'm so smitten with the havana latte that it really doesn't matter.

If you don't like sweet coffee, do not get the havana latte. But if you're a iced latte fiend like me, definitely try it. Havana latte's delicious secret comes from the condensed milk mixed with some regular milk and espresso. It's a wonderful, sweet, rich, treat. I also like their caramel and vanilla lattes which their housemade syrups but havana reigns supreme in my heart.

The FiDi location is quite small and will get crowded. The Bryant location is beautiful and huge and a perfect place to work.
author: Kate M.

description:
Pros:

 - Excellent pour over coffee
 - Good pastries

Cons:

 - Limited seating
 - No restrooms
author: John F.

description:
I checked out Coffee Bar in the FiDi.  It's a small shop, bright lights, & modern looking inside.  No seating inside, about 6 low chairs outside.

I got:

Chocolate Kouign Amann from Starter Bakery in Oakland $4.  It's good, though bought cold, so had to wait to heat it up at home.  Tasty.

Small latte $3.75 - It had a latte art which I like.  Coffee tasted ok & kept me awake for the evening talk I went to.

Charged $7.75.

No bathrooms for the public that I could see.  They sell Five Mountains Tea!
author: Ann L.

description:
Wow this must be the only place with a proper coffee machine in the area, coz the line is literally out the door in the morning.

The coffee wasn't that flash, but it usually isn't in the US anyway. They have a small range if wonderful looking golden baked goods, I tired the orange and current scone, and it made for a nice breakfast sweet treat on a cold morning. The bottles of vegetable and fruit juices were tasty, and a good way to ensure some nutrient intake if you know you're going to be busy the rest of the day.
author: Laura D.

description:
I am writing this review in hopes that someone at Coffee Bar on Montgomery will see it and take action. Your coffee rocks! This review is for your lids on your paper cups. They suck! Big time! I cannot make it the 2 blocks to my office without my hands getting coffee on them from the ill fitting lid. Then on my keyboard at my desk, my shirt, pants, desk, etc. And I thought it was just me but I mentioned it to my co-workers and everyone chimed in with the same stories! Please, get a different vendor for your damn to go cup lids!
Thank you  - and again, love your coffee!
author: Tim H.

description:
Great location for more-than-great coffee. Coffee Bar knows what it's doing when it comes to satellite locations and expansion. I know they've tried several times now with random hot-spots like the coffee expansion off of Big Daddy's antiques in Portrero Hill.  Maybe not exactly a hit, but at the end of the day it really does come down to location.

I think we've got a winner.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Killer coffee, and the Havana is amazing!!

They also have another location near 17th with TONS of space and wifi so u can logon and get to work!
author: David W.

description:
Coffee bar has been bookmarked for too long! Decided to treat myself to a pricey latte to rid myself of Monday morning blues -- Coffee bar did not disappoint. 

I read reviews before hand and saw some great buzz about their almond latte, which I ended up getting. It was delicious! The taste of the coffee was stronger than in some almond lattes I've tasted, where the almond latte overpowers most of the espresso flavors, but not this one. Even with the added splenda, the coffee flavor was strong and powerful, yet retaining the grainy almond milk taste. 

Tips:
+if you're in a rush, you can drop $2 into a jar and grab your own drip coffee to go. 
+almond milk is an extra 40/50 cents? 
+pretty latte art :)
author: Anu P.

description:
How could I have overlooked this place in the FiDi!? With a line swerving out the door during the afternoon coffee break period, I knew this had to a) be damn good, b) be overrated, or c) Starbucks/Peet's had malfunctioning coffee machines. Thank goodness the answer was A!

I knew this was going to be good the minute I entered and saw two amazing coffee machines. As my eyes scanned the menu, I saw Guittard and Recchiuti chocolate listed as an ingredient in some of the sweeter, chocolatey drinks. Oh dear, this place was going to be good! Coffee Bar definitely doesn't skimp on the quality of ingredients. 

I opted for the $4.00 Havana Latte...well, because Yelpers said so. I was not disappointed AT ALL. This drink is definitely not one to be missed! Not too sweet, but just sweetened enough (with condensed milk), this was deliciousness in a cup.

I'm seriously excited to be back in the FiDi just for this coffee shop!
author: Mansi A.

description:
Whenever I'm in SF for business, Coffee Bar is a crucial piece of my morning ritual. The staff is quick and friendly and the food is self-service, so don't let the long queues out the door dissuade you. And while perhaps this isn't the best coffee you'll drink in SF, what Coffee Bar lacks in my personal opinion of espresso perfection, it makes up for in delicious, grab-n-go cold pressed juices and a wide array of morning snacks from healthy to decadent. 

Don't be surprised if you see me schlepping a long black, a green juice, and non-fat yogurt pot down Montgomery Street every few months.
author: Laura N.

description:
Probably one of my favorite coffee places in FiDi.

Lately I've been infatuated with chai lattes. However, I'm quite particular; a chai latte isn't chai to me unless it has a bite of spice. Unfortunately, a lot of places I've tried lately doesn't fit this criteria but Coffee Bar does! In addition to having a good chai latte, they are pretty efficient in moving the morning coffee rush crowd along. 

The decor is a mix between hipster and modern. They also offer a variety of pastries, including cookies from Anthony's! They are famous for their Havana Latte, which is a latte made with condensed milk. Maybe I'll try it the next time I have a huge sweet tooth craving.
author: Becky M.

description:
I don't even like coffee (so no coffee snobbery here) but I seem slowly to be attracted to craft coffees. I tried the Havana latte and it was great! Sweetened with condensed milk so it has some heartiness to it 

Probably never conforming back to the mermaid cult America loves (Starbucks) after trying all these local coffee stops in the city.

Only downside is I don't know how people can afford to get coffee everyday at a whopping $3.75?! I'll have to make this a bi-weekly or once a week kind of pit stop.
author: Audrey C.

description: A wonderful cup of coffee - it tasted great on its own (no sugar, milk, etc.) and I noticed they sell Anthony's Cookies (http://anthonyscookies.com/). Too full on this visit, I look forward to coming back!
author: Cathy K.

description:
Remember the game where you lay all 52 cards from a deck upside down, alternate with someone flipping two cards face up at a time, with the intent of memorizing each card before making it hidden again, so that you can flip a pair during your next turn? Remember the joyous relief you felt when you finally flipped a matched set after wrestling with your bumbling memory? That is the same relief I felt when I discovered Coffee Bar, a coffee provider in the FiDi where the quality of drinks actually matched the district's uniform, wallet-draining prices.
 
The Vietnamese Iced Coffee embodies the desirable meld of a pro wrestler and a cherry blossom tree - its forceful caffeine content hurriedly punches you awake, while its intoxicating sweetness is emotionally uplifting. It is the ideal remedy for anyone seeking a mini-getaway from a stuffy, windowless office.
 
The foundational Vanilla Latte's evident identity crisis is manifested in its decision to feature neither a strong vanilla essence nor coffee taste. The sweeter and airier Havana Latte, which is not as serious as a normal latte, is perfect for later on in the week when the weekend's horizon becomes visible.
 
Should you be in search of an incapacitating breakfast, the Nutella Brioche bun is sturdy and fluffy all at once, and is thickly painted with the decadent, hazelnut paste.
 
Also, if you are running late for a teleconference, Coffee Bar offers a tank of freshly brewed coffee on the side of its counter for self-serve and self-pay. However, the lines are usually brisk if more than one barista is on hand.
author: Andrew M.

description: Wow! Lucky me! I finally found a legit coffee spot in the Financial District. It's a tiny spot with no place to sit, but they seem to move lines quickly. They have two Strada espresso machines which means serious business, they use locally roasted beans, they have a snack fridge for those on the go and most importantly, they've got a crew of smiling Batista's manning those Strada's. I may hale from the Southwest, where many think all we have is a lot of sun and tumbleweeds, which is true, but Tucson, AZ has it's own craft roasters and coffee connoisseurs too. I can't begin to describe the sense of relief I felt when I found this place, as I get lost looking for a good cup of coffee that's not Peet's or SB, on my way to the office every time I come to SF for work. The only downside? They're not open on the weekends!
author: Isabella J.

description: Pretty good soy chai. Not too sweet, and you can really taste the spices in the chai.
author: Lucy N.

description: I started the day right with a Havana Latte.  It's basically a sweeter version of a normal latte but there's something magical about the barista and the coffee beans they used.  I haven't enjoyed a great latte like this in a long time.  Smooth and sweet.
author: Ronald L.

description:
I asked my brother what his favorite coffee shop in the Financial District was, and he said Coffee Bar. It's a nice, immaculate little coffee shop with a nice menu and some tasty coffee.

I had a latte, which their "espresso of the day" card described as having bitter chocolate flavors. I'd say that was right on - a little more bitter than I usually like my espresso, but at least I felt like it had some character.

Prices are definitely high - they seem to be aiming for a boutique coffee experience (a la Blue Bottle, Four Barrel, etc.). Although I grabbed my latte to-go in a paper cup that will clog landfills for generations to come, I appreciated that they seem to steer their customers towards to-stay cups.
author: Andrew M.

description:
With a menu that boasts offerings like Guittard Hot Chocolate & Recchiuti Mochas, I was inclined to LUV Coffee Bar.....unfortunately this has not proven to be the case

After only getting 2 hrs sleep the night before, I was looking for something uber-strong that would keep me going for a full day at work

Was advised 3 shots are in their large (16 oz) - this is normally a good thing for me but this morning called for a little something extra.  Bring on #4!!

Latte was hot & milky but even with 4 shots, it was so smooth, I was suspicious that maybe all 4 shots weren't in there (was expecting an afterkick from the heightened coffee ratio but there was none)

Did it keep me going all day?  I was awake but not really jittery-energized like I was expecting to be.  In fact, this coffee might have to be a 4-shot standard.  Not sure if 3 would do even on a regular day.....but will try it out & reassess

$4.25 for a large - 3 shots ($4.75 for a 4-shot is a bit steep)

Next visit decided to test them out on their Mocha - the "basic" uses Guittard at $4.50 - the Recchiuti comes in at a whopping $4.75

This mocha has taken the title of "worst mocha ever".  It was to the point of being undrinkable.....I've made mochas at home w/ Hershey's Syrup that tasted better than this did.  Watery & a slightly bitter taste from the chocolate syrup they used.  I actually had an involuntary groan of disgust upon 1st sip & if that wasn't bad enough, it was served on the cold side of lukewarm.

So overall, I'd have to say 3-stars for the latte w/ the caveat I wouldn't call it A-OK but *only* OK & 1-star for the mocha averages out to 2-Stars

Further justification that my fav coffee spot in FiDi continues to be Prima Cosa.  They're cheaper, their lattes are always perfect & they serve Illy
author: Adrienne G.

description: Best mocha in town! I love their coffee quality! Very strong and tasty! Do recommend to try their seasonal special, it would always be a surprise and awesome taste!
author: Nina H.

description:
(See pics) Review #1122. 6 bucks seems a bit steep for a ginger scone (Starter Bakery) and a cap ($3.25.) The ginger was a bit strong for the scone. Would try other bakery items as they all looked fairly drooling attractive.

This Coffee Bar is very different from the original Coffee Bar. It has a slightly formal FiDi look than the more relaxed airy 2-floor shop in the Mission. It gives a clean feel and also uses Mr. Espresso beans.

Do like the fact that they carry yogurt and you can pick your own toppings. Five Mountains tea is definitely a nice plus too.

Service was pretty good and courteous.
author: T L.

description:
Ordered a drip coffee, which was alright. It seems like the caramel latte is the way to go per other Yelpers. 

My co-worker calls this place the "apple store of coffee shops" -- everything is very clean, modern, and neatly placed. Also, you come here for the hipster baristas with tattoos and nose rings. 

The drip coffee was better than starbucks, but I think I've had better at philz. I think the hand crafted coffees may be comparable to philz in that they are brewed by the cup. It twice as expensive as the drip coffee though. 

The regular latte that my co-worker got didn't have any fancy design on it like I expected like the spade or the heart -- fail! That's almost the best part of a latte :) 

There's no seating inside, so you can only get the coffee to go. Surprisingly, this place still has a line even though the Coffee Bean and Peet's are only feet away. That shows some customer loyalty! It's great for all the wannabe hipsters in the financial district.
author: Audrey L.

description:
This Coffee Bar location kept me caffeinated and happy all summer long.  I was in here once or twice a day M-F and was always happy with the service and the coffee. My usual go-to is a flat white but after trying the Vietnamese iced coffee one day and getting the tip from the barista to get it "less sweet" by using less condensed milk and more black coffee I was getting one nearly every afternoon.  The Havana Latte hits the spot as well (though it can also be a little too sweet for my tastes like the Vietnamese).  

Several mornings would be a coffee and a croissant with jam, and that was always satisfying.  The raspberry jam they serve is great and the pastries are decent, though nothing to write home about.  Oftentimes I would order one of their green juices (through Munchery instead of in store) and those were my jam too.  With several other locations if what you're looking for is good coffee and consistent service in FiDi this place is hard to beat.
author: Chloe B.

description: Only spot I know of that you can get Vietnamese Coffee without actually going to a Vietnamese Restaurant. Not AS good but still really good. Ordered the Chai today and it had a very different and interesting taste.  Not as sweet as Starbucks, definitely better than Peets version of Chai tea, but what was different is it had a nice spice kick to it. Something you don't notice in the beginning and is more of an after "taste". 4 for their interior design. It has a very commercial feel to it.  The white tables  and red reminds me of being at Target. Just my IMO, not somewhere you would want to sit and enjoy your coffee and read a book, which was probably the reasoning behind the choice of colors. Idk. I'm never there for more than 5 min. I would like to see more of them and see how they would do with a bigger location.
author: JJ S.

description:
Ordered up a Caramel Latte today.
Perfection in a mid-size cup.
...Great caramel flavor
...Powerful shots of espresso
...just the right-amount of-sweetness.
I'm cheating on Philz Coffee...ssshhh!
author: Derek N.

description:
amazing espressos, what more can I say ... bye bye starbucks, this place really got their stuff down good.

Thank you
author: Mike S.

description:
I went to coffee bar given that it was a place I've been wanting to try because I always walk by for my meetings. The atmosphere was honestly awesome, everybody seemed cool and just a bar like scene

However, they're laid back attitude is what cost them this review. The fact I stood there for so long after ordering, not one of the staff wondered why I stood there. My order never came. It wasn't even in QUE!! To top it off they didn't even make my drink right. I ordered a triple shot 12 oz Guittard  and I get a shot of machiatto... Why didn't I complain after getting the wrong order? Because they didn't seem to care still what's the point?

Way to ruin a guy's morning guys...
author: Ian C.

description:
Coffee Bar has good coffee, that's for sure. I like my coffee like I like my men: not covered in milk and sugar. If you too appreciate an unadulterated cup of coffee, I wouldn't recommend getting any fancy espresso drinks (lattes, mochas, etc). They're too sweet and they really detract from their coffee. Of course you could ask for less sugar, but why bother when a regular cup of coffee is better and much cheaper.

Their service has been hit or miss, usually miss but they're not horrifically rude or anything. Their bad service is characterized by dismissiveness and curtness.

There's also not much seating here, which doesn't seem to matter to most of the clientele who are just stopping in to get their daily dose before work.
author: Kathleen L.

description:
Umm, yum!

In my opinion, I think there are way too many coffee places in the FIDI and it still surprises me how EVERY coffee place has a line even when there is one every half a block.
So when Coffee Bar opened, I was just like, meh, another coffee place. At least it's not a chain (or IS it a chain? At least it's not as ridic as the Starbucks franchise.. seriously, there's like 7 or 8 within a 5 minute radius walk within my office)
As the days progressed, more people in work carried this white cup with the red Coffee Bar stamp on it. My coworker dragged me here.... and this is how the love began.

I looked at their money, and man, their shit is premium! Caramel latte with house-made latte (HELLA BEATS THE STARBUCKS CARAMEL BRULEE LATTE btw, and it comes with coffee art!). Hot chocolate made with Rechiutti chocolate? Yes, please!

The cost might be a bit more than Starbucks, but it's so worth it. Starbucks tastes watery and burnt compared to this!

The only downside was that the drink wasn't hot enough.. but since I'm sensitive to hot food and drinks so I could actually drink it right when I got it. So maybe it was a plus?

Overall, good drinks and good service. You can tell they love their jobs.. they answered every question I had about the coffees!
author: Emily C.

description:
This is some of the best espresso I have had anywhere, period.  The baristas are super friendly, the store is clean.  The espresso is served in a nice demitasse with spoon and accompanied by a glass of sparkling water.  Nirvana!

The only downside is, being in the financial district, they are only open Monday through Friday.
author: Pete J.

description:
...hand crafted!

While grabbing a coffee during the morning rush can be a forgettable experience Coffee bar is trying to inject a dose of pretentiousness into the comoditized market of morning coffee, with multiple starbucks cb&tl cos, and peets around, CB has its work cut out for it.

The hand crafted specialty roasts take a bit longer but id posit that they're worth the wait.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Had a cup of their Nicaraguan and just thought it was so/so Two bucks for a 12oz cup. I like the space as it is new,sleek and modern. I like the people that work there as they are cheerful,efficient, and helpful.

It is just that the product I chose was so so. In a city with so many amazing places to get my caffeine....I will try them again but I think there are better places to get my fix.
author: David G.

description:
Definitely a fan of the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. That is my main drink there. It's strong, causes your stomach to rumble (that's when you know it's good), and the staff are really courteous.

It's a great convenient place on the way to work to just grab a coffee and move on.
author: Albert K.

description: I absolutely love the vanilla latte.  That's where it's at if you're looking for a delish cup of coffee...I suggest getting this one!!! One of my faves!!!
author: Belle H.

description:
I've checking the various coffee houses in FiDi and came across Coffee Bar. As a former coffee house owner for over seven years, my first impression was good. Walked in and stood behind several people in line. This gave me time to scope out the place: #1 - Their espresso machine was flawlessly immaculate; #2 - They offer pour over coffees; #3 - Jordan makes a fantastic Cortado, (I also appreciate being asked if I wanted it to stay or in a to go cup); #4 - Smooth operation in coordination with friendly counter staff and talented baristas; #5 - Nice outdoor seating with warm wooden seats (not cold plastic, nor the torturous wire seats!); #6 - Nice latte art.  Although the art doesn't make the coffee taste better than it superbly is, the presentation is spot on. 

This location offers a great respite from the multitude of other "cookie cutter" shops.
author: Joe B.

description:
Coffee Bar in the FiDi (Financial District) this little funky and clean joint stand proudly in the middle of the busy streets of The FiDi. The queue can occassionally get long but it moves along quite quickly.

Upon recommendation on Yelp I decided to try the Havana Latte. It's a little pricey but I wanted to try it anyways. It's a very milky and delicious. I also went ahead and bought a bacon apple scone.

-----
+ Pro: Great Coffee shop located in the heart of the FiDi
- Con: Busy area, not really a spot to relax and enjoy your coffee.
( ^_^) Overall: A great place to grab your coffee.
author: James N.

description:
I waltzed into this place at 6am few weeks ago as I was trudging to the office, and what can I say? 
Well this place is definitely expensive, although not much more than a Starbucks (if you don't get drip coffee), but I got myself a latte just so I can get a little drawing, I love edible art.  The two gentlemen working at the bar made me a nice swan.  Pretty awesome and something different.
author: Omar L.

description: I went here yesterday for the first time and it was delicious! I tried the Havana coffee because it seemed to be the most popular. Now I can see why. It was delicious and not too sweet. I also got the iced Dolce Gusto coffee from the fridge. While I think it is way over priced it was still delicious. But I probably won't buy it again. The space is also small and when it's busy can bee hard to move around. I will definitely be back though :)
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Coffee Bar, Coffee Bar. You've ruined me.

When I was but a mere high school girl, I thought Starbucks was the best coffee in the world. When college came around, Peets became my go-to study buddy that never failed me. And then, a young graduate out of college, Coffee Bean became the luxurious "adult" drink that kept me company while I searched for those damn hard to find jobs.

But now, as a grown-up working in the FiDI, after merely two drinks at this treacherous-too-good-it-must-be-a-sin coffee shop - a delicious Havana Latte and a fancy schmancy soy latte - I became a cheater once again. 

I realized this today as I sadly sipped my Coffee Bean Mocha Latte, wishing that I walked a few more steps towards you instead.
author: Mandy C.

description:
I work across the street and grab a coffee there a few times a day, every day during the week. 2$ in and out. Now it costs $2.06 because of the optional health tax. What a pain in the ass. Why not lower the pice .06 cents so it still comes out to an even 2$?

No one helps pay for my insurance and I hate breaking a $20 just for 6 cents.

Later guys, forever
author: Lou Z.

description: This is by far one of the best places to get a delicious caffeine fix. My drink is always a whole milk cappuccino. The gang here is really great! From my pal Andrinea who is always a joy to see to Andy, Mehdi, Chelsea, Jack and others, five stars for sure! #coffee
author: Wilfred W.

description:
So, I just moved back to the Bay Area after being away for the better part of a year...where I came from (South Florida), the only coffee options consisted of Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. So, the story is:  after spending four hours wandering San Francisco, I was overcome by a dire need for a caffeinated break...Now, I refuse (mostly out of principal) to frequent a Starbucks for the first few months I'm back. But then I remembered -as I pulled out my phone to access Google Maps- that all I had to do to find a  small, non-chain coffee shop HERE was lift my eyes off of the pavement and look at each street corner. 
This time, I lifted my head and was instantly met by the sight of this simplistic, yet trendy coffee bar in the wall, called, well wouldntcha know--Coffee Bar. Haha. 
I ordered a cold brew and was pleasantly surprised by not only the delicious flavor, but the totally reasonable price. To be honest, I had been prepared to pay six dollars for a 12 oz drink, but I spent half of that. 
Great find in the heart of downtown.
author: Kyle B.

description:
I got a fancy version of a dunkaccino (espresso, hot chocolate) with a name I can't pronounce correctly - starts with an R and it was pretty good. If I was by Kixeye again I'd go back here instead of going to a known chain place like Starbucks. THe problems that you'll run into here are parking (because it's downtown san francisco) and how crowded the place is. People tend to get their coffee and just stand there blocking both the milk station and the exit. 

This is a fairly small spot so if you can cope with the crowd and the clueless, give it a try!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Mmmmm super smooth coffee. Coffee Bar is this little place tucked into Montgomery Street. Its stark, simple decor was a little bit jarring at first because I was expecting some sort of hipster/industrial feel. I had a standard cappuccino and it was soooooo good. Even though the espresso:milk ratio should be pretty fixed across most coffee places, Coffee Bar really gets it right. The prices here are steep but you get quality for your money. 

Next time, I'll try the Havana latte. That seems to be the most popular choice here.
author: Anna N.

description: I love the Vietnamese iced coffee here. It's so delicious! The service is also good. I always get my coffee quickly. It would be nice if they had more seating but it's perfect for getting coffee to go.
author: Ashley K.

description:
After passing Montgomery many times on my way to campus, I decided to give Coffee Bar a try.  I had high hopes: it was aesthetically really pretty inside, and the offerings on the side were packaged quite nicely.  The drip coffee sadly didn't hit the spot -- not something I'll be craving in the future.
