Also, all the "seating" are some chairs that are outside the building.  There's this random little ledge on the side of the store where you could gulp down a coffee/snarf down a snack, but that's about it.
author: Mel G.

description:
Cortado -  an espresso cut with a small amount of warm milk, sugar on bottom.

It was superb!  Definitely seems like a place where the baristas care that each espresso they make will taste good.
author: Steven F.

description:
Pros: Havana latte is indeed delish as advertised. There were many menu options and keen attention to detail. 

Cons: no public wifi (!?), very little seating area. I was planning to stick around and work, but no dice, unfortunately. 

I'd go back for another latte. Just don't plan to stick around!
author: Allison H.

description:
Quality black coffee. $2.50 a cup for the large and you get flavor. I've been here two days in a row and will to continue to stop in for a while. Great staff with tons of energy, very nice.

Personally I don't like the sleeve for hot cups that I have to assemble when I'm still 1/2 asleep at 6AM, really lame. Charge me more and do it right, its the FiDi we can afford it.
author: Justin S.

description:
Everyone who works here is super friendly and more importantly knows how to make a proper cup of coffee whether it be a latte, a cappuccino,  a machiato or just drip coffee. 

It's so hard to find a place that steams their milk correctly but this place manages to do it every single time. I've been here everyday for the past 3 weeks and my latte was perfect every single time!
author: Mahad A.

description: These guys know coffee like no one else!! Dump Starbucks and you will never regret it !
author: Deepthi M.

description: This place finally filled the hole in my heart for my favorite coffee shop.  After moving to SF from SD I was so sad I had not yet found my "go to" coffee place.  All the coffee shops in SF are so uppity and  " don't do an iced latte".  Which just annoys me to no end.  This place looks cool and hip and they will ice my damn latte.  THANK YOU!  The coffee is great always and their vanilla extract is made in house and is to die for.  Thank you coffee bar for not being as douchy as most of the other coffee shops.
author: Kendra J.

description:
This is the most delicious coffee spot in FiDi. The Havana latte is heavenly and many if their other specials are pretty great as well. I also really like their teas. 

The people working here and nice and friendly and even with long lines during work hours they make coffee pretty quickly.
author: Haris I.

description: Small coffee spot, difficult for it to differentiate from Philz, Peets, BlueBottle, and Workshop all within a few blocks. Unfortunately there is nowhere to sit and better options exist
author: Jim N.

description:
Staff was very helpful. Couldn't help but be drawn to this place with the smells of roasted coffee pouring into the street. You can not go wrong with this place. They have many choices and can offer most of their menu iced. 

I tried the Cortado as a pick me up, quick shot of espresso with sugar on the bottom. One of the workers suggested trying a Vanilla Latte or Havana Latte for a sweeter option next time. I will be back.
author: Matt M.

description:
Had a cup of drip, dark roast.  The coffee is all right.

Ordered a quiche to go with my coffee; it was untoasted and unheated.  If I could've gotten a warm bite with my coffee or free wifi, this might've been a 4 star review.
author: Eric H.

description:
When I started working in the city around Montgomery street, everyone (including my co-workers) would talk about this place called "Coffee Bar." My first question was whether it's better than Philz Coffee (which btw, I'm extremely addicted to)....people said no, but that it's still REALLY good. 

I tried the Havana Latte with soy...and from that point on I was convinced this would be my "go-to" coffee spot during my work day! They put a bit of condensed milk to sweeten up the coffee, which I think is their "secret" to the latte. i still have yet to try any of their other latte's, but I have heard their caramel latte is pretty tasty! 

If you're around the area, I'd suggest stopping by this place. It can get pretty busy in the morning and around early afternoon, but the line goes by fast. Sometimes, it takes a while for the baristas to give you your coffee/make it, but it's worth the wait, I swear!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Probably my favorite spot in the city for a crafted drink. 

I'm definitely not a latte or chai person but now I realize it's because I never had It made like coffee bar. 

Havana latte is a must try, every sip is velvety smooth (if you can use that to describe a latte) it's made with condensed milk so that's probably why, but soo good!

Their chai with almond milk is also one of the best ones I've had (even over the chai cart, imo) much stronger and spicier flavor throughout the entire cup. 

There's prepared foods (yogurts, granola, sandwiches) and fresh daily pressed juices in their refrigerated section. 

It gets pretty busy in the AM but well worth the wait before strolling into the office!
author: michelle l.

description: Coffee Bar gets extra points for being a small biz, I believe they have one other location other than this one. I like the minimalistic decor and menu. They have a handful of drink options and food options. I saw some sandwiches, yogurt and cookies from Speciality. Looks like a good option if you just want to grab and go. I was meeting someone there and just got a hot chocolate. It was pretty good but lukewarm which was surprising. I prefer that to getting drinks that scalding hot, so no complaints from me.  They have a few chairs outside and I got to catch up with my friend and also watch the hustle and bustle of the city.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Fabulous!  Cannot get enough of this place!

Iced mochas are always delish and the little parfait bar (with non-fat, plain yogurt, yay!) is my favorite.
author: Lisa G.

description:
Update to my prior review: now I DO walk past you everyday on my way to work!!!

Exceptionally friendly baristas and amazing coffee, to boot. Coffee Bar FiDi, you've got my vote. Now, if only I walked past you on my way to work every morning....

P.S The Havanna latte just blew my mind.
author: Liz W.

description:
This was a daily stop for me during my trip. Their lattes are crafted with love and care. 

I really fell in love with their Vanilla Latte. It's the best I've ever had.

Hey Coffee Bar, any plans of setting up shop in LA? :)
author: K C.

description: Good place to stop in for a cup of coffee, or better yet, an espresso or latte. I like coming in here for a cup on my way to the office. Oftentimes it gets very busy and crowded, especially during that morning rush, so avoid that if you can. There's limited seating, but I wouldn't sit there for more than a few minutes as you're basically in the way of foot traffic. This is a great place to get a coffee and pastry and if you want to support local businesses.
author: Grayson E.

description: The wheatgerm cookie from this place was surprising delicious, despite the odd name. The service at this place was amazing, shout out to the girl with the black bangs for cheering up my day!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Tried the Vietnamese Iced Coffee-- not as good as the Havana Latte. The Havana is definitely still #1 in my heart.

Also heard the chai is divine. Will have to try some time, when I can give up the Havana.


UPDATE: Have you tried the Vanilla Latte! Just as good as the Havana but doesn't have the condensed milk. And most of their drinks taste better with whole milk rather than non-fat. Worth the calories.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Here's a dirty little secret I found out about them. They Mr Espresso as their source of beans. 

They don't travel to some exotic location and sample beans from different farmers. They use locally purchased beans from a vendor. 

So when you're thinking about buying a bag of coffee from them marked at $8, you're just buying something you can get from the grocery store.
author: D M.

description:
Wake up to a smile, a good ole' cup o' jo and some incredibly tempting pastries at Coffee Bar. 

The shop literally glows a golden yellow from the street during grim, cool mornings in San Fran. I imagine this would be what pirates experience when stumbling across a cave of buried treasure. 

This place welcoms you with quickly moving lines of coffee addicts, a friendly smile and patient customer service guy at the counter (always with a beard of course) and 3 baristas serving up foamy, creamy soy lattes minus the crappy latte art.
author: Chloe R.

description: My number one coffee spot. Rich, dark, coco notes with the absolute best foam, period.
author: Garrett G.

description:
Mmm...now this is how you make a latte.
Without sounding pretentious (but let's be honest, I love it) this is what coffee tastes in Europe...because yes...it really does taste different.
There are not many places that I will get a plain latte without any flavoring or sweetener.  When the coffee is good, the milk addition is all that's needed...and the coffee...is GOOD
And their pastries are such perfect buttery things I could eat them all day (and gain 20 pounds in the process.)
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Fantastic...if you don't mind waiting 15 minutes for a cup of coffee. 

I'm too grumpy pre-caffeine to wait that long for anything. Unless you can nap standing up -then, two birds, one stone.

I've switched to the Peets in the BART station. In and out in under 5 minutes and still a damn fine Americano.
author: Krista M.

description:
Havana latte! What! Amazing!

The fresh spinach juice is nice, too.
author: Maria D.

description: This place makes an insanely good cup of coffee.   My coworkers and I have started coming here over Peet's a few months ago and let me tell ya, their Americano kicks serious ass!   There's always a line of people and the place is constantly packed, but that's simply because these guys truly understand the art of coffee.   Well done, Coffee Bar!
author: David O.

description:
Love the coffee and the pastries. The atmosphere is a bit strange as it is deliberately trying and failing at being a hipster haven. 

I recommend getting an old fashioned cappuccino or a cortado. Its the right amount of milk for their roast of espresso. 

I reviewed this coffee shop and other hipster coffee shops on my blog, check it out: http://missionhipsters.wordpress.com/
author: Kevin C.

description:
Did you know that a Havana latte is made with condensed milk? 

Well now you do -and they make them here. I'll be in Havana in March, I will have to confirm the authenticity of this :)

They make a mean vanilla soy latte too! Cheery baristas + strong coffee = happy mornings!
author: Sara P.

description: This is my favorite place for coffee in The City. The Mission location is my favorite, but the drinks are good everywhere. Vanilla Bean Latté!
author: Madeleine M.

description:
Drip coffee is a good, light roast here. 

One request for improvement: Please stop serving coffee in double paper cups - that's an incredible waste of resources. Get sleeves if needed.
author: Sierra M.

description:
Go for the Bolivian Drip. Strong and delicious.
Only $2.00 and if you have two bills, you can drop it in the jar and go.
author: Johnny O.

description: What a great biz, coffee done right. Super friendly staff, love the location and it never seems to bother them making my cuppa joe just the way I like. 5 stars fellas
author: james p.

description:
So I'm not a coffee connoisseur and (sadly) I just like stuff from Sbux on the regular. I decided on a random day to venture out to find a latte that would be my special treat on days where Sbux just won't cut it, and by the looks of this, I might have just found it!

I ordered a small soy caramel latte. For $4.50, I expected a little more but whatever, I didn't go in with any expectations. After a 5 minute wait, I was delivered my little cup of latte.

They filled it all the way to the brim so be sure you have steady hands to transport your cup over to the lids station by the door. I have mixed feelings about places that don't put a lid on your coffee but I guess that's apart of the presentation.

Regardless, I took a sip and was pleasantly surprised. It was delicious! It wasn't bitter, sour or too strong, it was a happy medium. I really enjoyed my soy caramel latte from Coffee Bar! I definitely will be back sooner than later!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Everything tastes sooo good, it just doesn't feel - right.  

Kouign-Amann, Havana latte, and cookie = 10$.   Reminder: the extra cash is worth it when you get what you pay for.  Here, tastes like Blue Bottle, without the lead - they might roast the beans too well.  Small batch roasting: burnt the caffeine right out? I don't know.  I think I will stick to BB or P's where I still get some zip.   

- might have to go back for that Kouign-Amann though- ugh sin sinfully good.
- if you are charmed by coffee art, stop by.
author: Rayna A.

description:
I debated giving this place 2 or 3 stars but decided on two because there is simply something that must be acknowledged about Coffee Bar's espresso that cannot be overlooked:  it is bland. It is just so terribly bland you might think that they just pulled your shot from some frozen Starbucks beans. Honestly I've given this place many, many tries and the lattes are very consistent. And very consistently worse than just about any latte I've had by an independent coffee vendor in the city.  Meh. I've experienced better.

This is a shame because I love the space (slick, clean, and modern) and the people seem nice. They have fancy machines, fancy pastries, (and fancy prices) but if you like coffee from places like Blue Bottle, Sightglass, Ritual, Four Barrel, etc then you will be sorely disappointed by the coffee at coffee bar.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Friendly faces, good coffee. 

Faith based pay system for grab and go coffee! Just put $2 in the jar, grab your coffee and go! 

I got a cappuccino. 13 minutes of waiting at 8:15am :/ not my favorite.
author: Kortni S.

description: Ordered a "hand crafted" pour over coffee and was told they were too busy to make one.  Then had the nerve to ask me what else I wanted.  Put my money back in my pocket and went onto the next ubiquitous coffee bar...
author: Matthew B.

description:
This place is fantastic!  The Havana latte is not to be missed.  I had my first Kouign Amann here and it was awesome.  It reminded me of a palmier, but made with distinctly salted butter.

In my quest to find the perfect ham & cheese croissant, I tried the one offered by Coffee Bar (and made by Starter Bakery in Oakland).  Unfortunately, with the tiniest sliver of ham and barely any cheese, this could've passed as a plain croissant with an aftertaste of meat and cheese.  Boo... Fortunately, my search continues!

Go here for the Havana!
author: Lynnie P.

description: I'm torn about Coffee Bar. I want to love it but something holds me back. Starbucks will do in a pinch, but I prefer Blue Bottle/Curbside Coffee/Paramo type establishments over large chains. I was excited to try the Havana latte and it's nice but a little too sweet. I've also had the cappuccino which was okay, but I can get the same thing over at HeyDay (they also use Mr. Espresso). Also, what's up with getting charged extra for tax/takeout? No other coffee shop, large chain or independent, does this and I find it annoying and expensive.
author: Bella L.

description: It would only make more sense if they were wearing lab coats.
author: David S.

description:
When I moved to San Francisco, I walked around the Financial District to get familiar with my new surroundings and stumbled upon this gem hidden tucked away within 101 Montgomery. So I walked in craving a latte for whatever reason and decided that the Havana latte was the way to go. Not really sure what prompted me to think of it but oh man was I pleasantly surprised. With that said I will warn folks that although I enjoy it, it might be a bit sweet for some folks so just as fair warning to those who do not like sweet drinks...
The service here is super friendly and I like how they make art out of the coffee itself. Have had their spinach and feta / Ham and cheese croissants and both were delicious as well. Definitely a spot I try to hit up once a month since its way better than the local Starbucks. 
Have not tried their drip coffee but I hear it's solid as well! I highly recommend anyone to check it out.
author: Dan M.

description: Hello morning! Nothing starts my day off like a cup from this place- everything tastes great and the staff is never zombie-like even first thing in the morning. This is a must try for everyone in this area!!
author: Laura J.

description: This place is fancy & clean. Got the Havana latte (condensed milk = a lil too sweet) & the caramel latte (yum!). I don't know much about coffee, but their equipment is legit and quite a step up from Starbucks. There's no place to sit inside. Although there are some chairs outside, with the SF winds blowing through, this is def. a grab & go kind of coffee place in FiDi.
author: Emily C.

description:
Great coffee, super dark roast, real coffee!  Very good quality.  4 stars because it is a bit of a wait to get your drink.

Hot chocolate was amazing, Guittard brand, one of the best, not too sweet.

Definitely worth trying!
author: Xela C.

description:
I smile a big, evil smile as I walk past about 80 different Coffee Bean and Starbucks' with lines out the door knowing that when I get to Coffee Bar, I will walk in the door and someone will ask to start making my drink. 

I know this place won't stay under the radar for long, but right now its probably the quickest high-quality drink you can get in the financial district. 

Mostly I love coming here because the staff is really, genuinely friendly. And they make great latte art. And they make a cappuccino so good it makes me not care if I'm late to work.

Also, the pastry selection looks pretty impressive. I've only begun to work my way through it.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Bad Service. Pour over takes more time and that's why I was willing to pay 5+ for a cup of coffee. But it was only half of cup and sour as hell. Disappointed
author: Jessica L.

description:
Both the coffee and the service (efficient, very friendly and welcoming) here are truly excellent.  This is my go to for morning coffee (unless I get it together and bring from home).  The dark roast does not mess around:  deep, rich, flavorful and wakes me up pretty much instantly.   Superlative quality and interesting varietals are definitely a focus.  Love that they have brown sugar too.   Breakfast items are across the board excellent; plenty of savory choices which I appreciate (not a sweet breakfast person).

I sometimes head up here in the afternoons as well for their chai tea latte, which is the best I have ever had; really gingery and not too sweet.  

One of my favorite things about Coffee Bar isn't even the coffee (which, as mentioned, is excellent) but the delicious takeaway salads for lunch.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
You might not think that the average coffee or latte you spend $5 on everywhere else is as blah as it actually is...until you have coffee from Coffee Bar. Full disclosure: I'm glad that caffeine addictions are socially acceptable because I definitely have one. That being said, getting caffeinated at Coffee Bar is a truly enjoyable experience. The non-acidic, deep richness of their espresso mixed with the most heavenly cloud-like steamed milk (and I only ever get non-dairy milks in my lattes which adds a level of impressiveness to this feat) never fails to put me on Cloud 9. I have tried their regular latte, vanilla latte & caramel latte. Every single item I've ever ordered forces me to almost stop in my tracks or consider dancing down the sidewalk on my way back to the office. The caramel latte, as a previous reviewer stated, has a delectable burnt almost creme brulee taste to it & the vanilla syrup has actual vanilla bean in it. All syrups are made in house & you can definitely taste the preservative-free difference in your drink. 

Next time you're thinking about going to Starbucks or Peets in the Financial District, walk the extra few blocks & spend your money at Coffee Bar. Yes, it will be just as expensive - but you will taste the difference. I can't recommend it highly enough.
author: Elise G.

description:
i heard great things about this place so i had to check it out.

i ordered the caramel latte, which they typically don't have in many small coffee shops in SF. i was VERY impressed by it and I have to make a bold statement by saying this is probably the best caramel latte i've had up to date. the caramel doesn't overpower the coffee but compliments it very well. it was not too sweet either which is very easy to happen when you order anything caramel in coffee shops.

i am so glad i went to this place and will be back again.
author: Spencer E.

description:
Oh
my precious ...
it wants the bean drug
it puts it in the cup
it brings snob-quality caffeine to the financial wasteland
er
district
Coffee Bar Montgomery:
yes there is a God ...
author: Mateo L.

description:
Wow, so good!  I've been walking by this place for so many times, and I just gave in today to go in for a cup of latte.   I saw on yelp, right before I walked in, and read about their caramel and havana latte, both being very good.  I ordered a cup of havana, since it sounded special, which the guy told me it was made with sweet condensed milk.  Even better. 

It took awhile for my cup of latte to be ready, but it's because their set up is an individual drip for each cup, which allows extra time.  I didn't mind.  Loved my coffee art when she handed me my cup, and the first sip....OMG!  Definitely was something different and already got me thinking of going back tomorrow already!  I'm going to order the caramel latte next!
author: Nancy S.

description:
In cities such as San Francisco, the people who work in the Financial District undoubtedly have the cash flow to eat and drink a little more extravagantly. Heck, coffee at sleek little establishments isn't even much more expensive than other establishments with the word "Bean" or "Bucks" in the name.

That being said, individuals have the means to patronize cool, local joints to grab a caffeinated beverage and artisan baked good. Perhaps Starbucks will one day offer pourover in order to win over the joes who drink joe that is not mainstream. Also, I urge you to avoid any chain while in cities such as SF.

They offer a good variety of drinks, including pourover--hand drip! Unfortunately, I would have really liked to sit inside on the rainy day, but CB only offers a inside pass through and grab. You just can't drink inside, BUT there are cool little seats outside.

Lastly, the abundance of locally sourced baked goods offered the perfect buttery and sweet items with which to balance out your morning drank.

Coffee Bar is a fantastic alternative to anything in the neighborhood i.e. Peet's and the other big 2, and I commend them for their pretentiousness. The uppity craftiness here sells, and they do a good job at not making it too inaccessible. Why not skip out on corporate America while in SF and drop on in here?
author: Solomon W.

description:
I love Coffee Bar - it's one of my favorite coffee shops in the city hands down. 

But this location's management seriously has a few things to work on. 

1. Credit Card System is constantly breaking down -- It's at least several times a week I hear the baristas have to yell out to everyone in the shop that their credit card system/register is having issues and people either need to pay in cash or the names are not coming through. Once it happens that consistently you should really reconsider your vendor. 

2. Inventory Check and Planning-- Their chai is one of my favorite in the entire city. But their inventory is consistently out to the point where I want to ask whether they have Chai in stock before going through the rush hour wait. After waiting in line for 15 minutes it's really annoying to then be told they don't have the drink you were waiting for. They could do a better job planning their inventory for the demand in advance, and if not at least having signs up letting people know when key items on their menu are out for the day.
author: Rachel L.

description: The cappuccino I ordered was very smooth and aromatic, might be one of the best I've had. The espresso drinks are on a pricey side, but I'll definitely be coming back for the cappuccino! Baristas were quite friendly as well and the decor is modern and simple.
author: Maggie G.

description:
Sorry to write a somewhat bad review but this place isn't that great. I mean, seriously. My typical drink is a soy cappuccino and the first time I had it was good but it is most definitely a hit or miss every time I go in. I tried the vanilla latte which tasted like a regular soy latte which I did not like at all, couldn't even finish. The place is so cramped which isn't there fault. 

It's nice that they do latte art but that's not really that important for the FiDi at 8am on a Monday morning.
author: Onyinyechi I.

description:
The havana and vanilla lattes are really very delicious. The pastries, especially the scones, are pretty good but definitely not worth a trip to Coffee Bar on their own. 

If you get there fifteen minutes before eight or nine in the morning, be prepared to wait some five minutes for your latte because this is in the heart of the financial district. It's a very small space, and you'll probably have to shift yourself several times as people ask you whether you're in the queue to order. If you get tired of moving around as your latte comes out, sit on the absolutely gorgeous patio furniture outside. I asked about the benches and chairs, and they were commissioned by the design firm Selamat--in case you were curious.

The food in the refrigerator is delicious, as well. I've had several of the small dishes, including a curried chicken and a salami sandwich, and I'm surprised that they were well priced on top of being conveniently packaged to go. You can also buy a small container of yogurt here, and it'll come with a small selection of toppings, including nuts, some homemade jelly, etc. 

Note: if it's regular coffee you're after, you can just fill it up yourself and put cash into the jar next to the brewer. It's a great setup.
author: Bee L.

description:
Horrible services, they have 8 people working in the morning and it takes them forever to make a Mocha.  The way how this establishment operates reminds me of a great screwing a  light bulb joke.   Furthermore everything at this place is ridiculously expensive and the portions are small.  Anyone who wants better coffee, pastries and place to sit down can get it at Peet's , Starbucks, or  Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf

Wake and smell the coffee, you are in The Financial District where time is money.
author: E M.

description:
Poked my head into the under-constructio Coffee Bar on Montgomery last week & asked them when the opening was. They said on Monday, October 10, 2011.

I love their cafe in the Mission - warm service, delicious pastries & cortados - so I can't wait for them to open up around the corner from work!
author: Sharand N.

description: I love local SF coffee shops; I know this is a chain of coffee shops as well, but less so than Starbucks. I come here every once in a while to change up my usual coffee break. I love the vanilla latte and mocha (they have 2 different kinds). Delicious coffee, nice people, what more can you ask for? They also have $2 help yourself coffee; just drop in $2 and pour yourself a cup.
author: Katherine S.

description:
I'm a huge fan. I've been coming to Coffee bar almost on a daily basis for quite sometimes now.

I've tried different independent shops around the area. This is the place to go.

I love coffee. I know my coffee.

This place get packed in the morning, and around 3PM when you just have to get some caffeine in your system.  

HERE ARE THE TIPS OF A REGULAR:

IN THE MORNING:

If you want to just grab a regular coffee, they have $2 in a jar. Which means, it's a self-serve coffee pot, you can put $2 in this glass jar and serve yourself a large coffee. 

IN THE AFTERNOON:

Avoid the 3PM crowd if you're in a hurry. Most people stroll in around 2:30-3PM because that's the time to boost your spirit before your boss yells at you for falling asleep at your desk.

STAMP CARD:
They have a stamp card. Get a stamp for each coffee you get. Once you fill it up, the next one is free. Pretty awesome deal.

TWITTER:
They sometimes will re-tweet your post about their delicious coffee and offer you a free one if you show the tweet.

They know their coffee. If you appreciate great coffee, especially the latte foam that shouldn't be hidden under a lid, you should definitely check this place out.
author: Jessica D.

description:
They are OPEN! 

Came in for my morning coffee and croissant - yum and yum! 

Will start adding Coffee Bar into my morning coffee routine.
author: Julie F.

description:
Friday I had the best decaf americano here.  It was foamy, just the right texture, so fresh that you felt you just picked the coffee beans and roasted right then and there.Mid week last week, I tried an exotic African drip coffee. It was absolutely delicious and super fresh again. Nothing like gourmet coffee smell!!!

I asked the barista behind the counter (his name is Bear or something like that). He said that there are a handful of coffee farms the owners work with and that the owners are ultra anal about picking the right coffee beans. My favorite coffee shop is now a tie between Blue Bottle and these guys. And because of the office location proximity advantage, I think Coffee Bar is my new fave. And the two times I have been there these guys were much faster than Blue Bottle in wait time (I mean A LOT faster because I rememember waiting 15 minutes in the Ferry Building for Blue Bottle).  On Friday even though there was a line in front of Coffee Bar, my americano arrived in less than 2 min. 

Let's hope they maintain coffee quality.
author: bora o.

description: The Vietnamese Iced Coffee is perfection! Not overly sweet so you can taste the high quality coffee behind the condensed milk. A wonderful morning treat to start the day!
author: Yekaterina R.

description:
I have given this place the benefit of the doubt twice and they have sucked both times.  I wish they didn't because they are just down from where I work but both times I have been disappointed.  I have ordered a latte and a chai and they were both luke warm and their chai sucks.  

There are ten people working there and it seems to take them forever to make a simple latte.  Also they have cookies and muffins that are so small that you have to buy two.  I am not someone who wants a giant muffin for breakfast but at least get some that are a normal size.  

I am a supporter of the little guy but not a fan of this place.  I will have to stick with peets or starbucks across the street.  Why these people put their coffee shop between two large chains is beyond me.  If you are going to do that then your coffee and your service better be kick ass.  This place has neither.
author: Stacie B.

description:
Had an opportunity to try their coffee during the pre-opening. There were 3 factors that really stood out about this place for me.

1) Coffee - Never had a latte that was so creamy with bold flavors. It was far beyond anything that you'd get in your local Starbucks and Peet's. The individually made coffee was amazing as well and stacks up to Philz, Blue Bottle, etc, but without the fancy names. I kinda appreciate how this place leaves out the gimmicky, marketing words.

2) People - The owner's passion, expertise, and creativity is evident. Similar to the way not everyone appreciates one artist, I'm sure not everyone will appreciate Coffee Bar. With Coffee Bar, the owner has created his own style and uses his methods of what he believes make the best cup of coffee. The employees appear to be just as passionate as the owner and carries the philosophy of perfecting each individual cups. 

3) Price - It's surprisingly not expensive. I got my drinks for free, but when I looked at the prices, I thought, "Really? Have I been getting ripped-off at other places all this time?"
author: Min K.

description: This was my morning coffee joint when I worked on Montgomery.  Friendly baristas and dependable quality make this place as popular as it is with worker bees like myself.  Line can get a bit long sometimes, especially during morning rush hour (like 8:30-9am weekdays).
author: Richie T.

description: The caramel latte is the best specialty coffee drink I have ever had in my life.  Deep slightly burnt caramel flavor, not too sweet, creamy and with a hearty bang of caffeine.  Yes, yes, yes, more please.
author: Olivia W.

description: Don't let the decor fool you. Nice open airy space, but the coffee leaves a lot to be desired. Got a regular cup of coffee which was kinda burnt and didn't give me that caffeine buzz. They got some nice chairs and stuff outside for people watching. Overall it's AITE.
author: John B.

description:
Ok--for all you black coffee/drip drinkers, this review doesn't apply. This is an ode to Coffee Bar's ridiculously amazing caramel latte. Treat yoself, guys.

Sometimes (especially with specialty drinks), you'll have pockets where the flavor is perfect, and others where the milk didn't blend in and bitterness punches you in the mouth. That's never the case here. The baristas here really know their stuff, and I can sip my drink start to finish without ever noticing a change in taste. This applies to their mochas and regular lattes as well--but the caramel latte is just too perfect to miss. The only other one I've had that is a close contender is from Coffeehouse Northwest in PDX.

The sweet flavor is subtle and nutty, balancing beautifully with the espresso and with just the right amount of milk. Whatever ratio they use, it's perfect. 

The baristas here are always super friendly, too. They always have a ton of people working at once, which keeps the line moving fast.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Finally good coffee in a java wasteland! Skip Starbucks and come right over here. prepacked beans are tasty & affordable. 
smoking hot baristas and wallet friendly sandwiches. 

minus .5 star for the price of soy lattes. close to 4 bucks a cup but still very tasty.
author: Christina L.

description:
I'm also on a quest to visit all of the coffee places in San Francisco, and by now, I've seen quite a few. I'm a big fan of strong, black coffee; and as such, I ordered a large dark roast (although, I unfortunately forgot to keep note of its origin.)

It's on par with some of the better, but forgettable, coffees that I've had. They also had a selection of single-made drip coffees, but for the price (up to $3.75), I'd be tempted to take a walk to Philz, Blue Bottle, or Epicenter Cafe (my top three.) If you don't have the time to go far for a quality cup of coffee, this isn't a bad place - it's just not the best place.

I also ordered an almond croissant; it was one of the better ones I've had. I'm not sure where they get their baked goods (I don't think they do them in-house, but I could be mistaken.)

tl;dr: good, not great, probably not worth the price
author: Jack L.

description:
The product group at work decided to try out Coffee Bar today.
I am drinking a Caramel Latte from this place right now.Absolute heaven !

One of my friends also tasted it and loved it. He is not even a coffee drinker !

The lady at the cash counter is very sweet. Also tried the mini brownie, it looked so cute and small and soft .. how can I not have it !
The brownie was very different, a good different though !! 

Will return.
It is in my office building. What more would I want :-}
author: P D.

description:
Large Drip, Light Roast for a Dark Brother.  FYAH Every Time!!!!  Boom Shot FiDi Dem!!  More FYAH on the Roast!!  BOOM!!!!

Thug Life Approved!!!!  These hustlers be given my homie Phil a run for his money, serving up only the highest grade, dank brews.  The C Bar Crew straight running the block on Montgomery, all dem bustas at Peets and Tully's best watch dem backs...  Blue Bottle, be warned, these C Bar Bloods beee creepin' up on ya weak sauce....   Ya heard me!!!!!    BOOM!!!!
author: Ubique K.

description:
Hmmm....cookies from Anthony's and pasteries hand selected from some of the best bakeries in San Francisco? Yes please! The bran muffins are to die for and sell out by 9:30. 

THEY HAVE CORTADOS! Why aren't other coffee houses taking note of this  cuban mini cappuccino? 

The coffee is from Mr. Espresso, which for some reason tastes better when they prepare it. Probably because they get their coffee fresh and direct from the source. Go there, you will like it.
author: sarah m.

description:
Starbucks may be acceptable during road trips to the countryside, but it really sucks having to go to one in SF. Thank goodness for Coffee Bar in the FiDi. A true gem in a sea of Starbucks and Peet's.

Sadly, my enthusiasm for Coffee Bar will likely wane if they ever open up a Philz around these parts.
author: J K.

description:
Guatemala take 3-5 min well worth it 
Lattes are good
Quiches
spinach feta croissant
patisseries
author: Brandy L.

description: Though I did not order a drink, my friend did when we came by because Plentea was way too crowded. The cafe is nice and quiet, with a very hip vibe. There were tons of baristas behind the counter and yet when the drinks were coming out, the baristas had no idea whose drinks were who's. I feel a system of number calling might help (if this detail has already become outdated, just nix this). A lot of people were standing around because it seems there aren't really any places to sit in this cafe. I probably wouldn't want to come and stand just to enjoy a cup of coffee. Can't rate higher or lower because I didn't get a drink, but my friend did say that her latte was sweeter than other places.
author: Alex T.

description:
I've walked by this place many many times but never thought to stop by. My friend who also works in the financial district asked me to meet her here for afternoon coffee. She recommended the Havana Latte... open to trying new things. MM MMM MMM delious!!! 
They serve vietnamese iced coffee!! My FAVORITE!!!! The lines are long, the wait isn't too bad. The decor is minimal/hip/trendy, the place is small and can get crowded but definitely worth a try. Must trust a long time =)

I will definitely stop by here more often for my afternoon coffee.
author: Penelope V.

description:
3.5 stars, but I didn't feel generous enough to round up.

Their coffee's not bad.  I had a cappuccino and the first few sips of it was really strong and bitter, though towards the end, it was less so and a lot more smooth (I'm assuming it was probably the foam catching the strong taste).  Not a bad coffee, though not spectacular either.  Frankly, the bitterness part really got to me.  Don't get me wrong, I frequently drink black coffee straight, so it's not that I'm adversely affected by bitterness.  However, the bitterness I experienced from the cappuccino seemed it stemmed from a source that was not natural for the bean.  It was a bitterness that seemed to be from over-burnt coffee beans, so I had to subtract 1 star.  Another minus .5 star for the price.  The price was not justified by the quality in my opinion, however I would still choose this over Peet's.
author: Jenn L.

description: Tried havana latte and walnut cookies .Delicious.Great customer service.Will be back for more.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Super cute coffee spot in the financial district. They serve those amazing Mr Espresso beans which make a dark rich espresso shot that warms the soul. They also sell the beans for your home. The staff was very friendly. Robert was friendly and went out of his way to accommodate me. Thanks!
author: Pierre C.

description: I really like this place due to the freshness of the coffee. Their lattes are really good too. They also leave really cute designs when you get a latte (which is always nice). Also, the people that work there are really fast, organized and very friendly! I am definitely a fan.
author: Maria G.

description: This place is good when you're in a pinch. I like the $2 self serve coffee and the Gusto bottled cold press coffee (although greatly overpriced). This place gets a 2 star for it's overpriced drinks and snobby employees. There are far better, friendlier, more reasonable options in the area. Coffee Cultures, for example, is just around the corner with better coffee, more interesting and friendlier staff. Funny because I believe Coffee Bar and Coffee Cultures are owned by the same people.   But if you're in a hurry, skip the lines and grab a $2 self serve!
author: Aaron N.

description:
Seriously the best Americano I've had--I have to start by saying that. This place is SPOTLESS with gleaming/gorgeous expresso machinery that reminds me a little of Rome.  Very modern feel and attentive people behind the counters--truly happy to be there (that's rare, right?). Popping in here is a great escape, even if just for a few minutes. 

Yes--as some other Yelpers commented--there is no seating inside. Its small, so it wouldn't work. But there is seating outside underneath a covered archway, so if you have time, you can have a quick sit and moment of people-watching before you jet back to your office.  

Also, I love that they get their coffee locally at Mr Espresso in Oakland, and that they use local Clover Stornetta in Marin(?)  for 1/2&1/2, milk, etc. 

I've been back 3 times in two days. A bit obsessed already.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Stopped in with some coworkers this morning to try this place out. 
#1 - it's really small and at 8:45 even though there were probably only about 10 people in the store it was hard to not be in someone's way.
#2 - it's pretty slow if you want anything other than the pre-made coffee
#3 - it's way more expensive than Starbucks or Peet's. Ya ya, I'm all about supporting the little guy too, but $4.75 for a latte? I opted for a small coffee for $2.
#4 - alright, I'm nitpicking now but they hand you the super hot cup of coffee sans hot sleeve which you have to take over to the counter and then assemble the hot sleeve yourself. How hard would it be for them to just do it for me so I don't burn my hands? Not very.
#5 - while the people at Peet's and Starbucks are (overly) friendly, I didn't feel welcomed by the cashiers at Coffee Bar. They seemed kind of frazzled actually, maybe just overwhelmed by having just opened? Let's hope so.

The coffee was pretty good and their pastries (which I didn't try) looked tasty. Unfortunately, items 1-5 above mean I will likely be returning to Starbucks for my morning brew in the future.
author: Rachel E.

description: Solid coffee.
author: Andrew K.

description: With a beginning to end Kalita Wave kit (the only other one I know of is at Wrecking Ball) -- flat bottom -- yes, the kind of bottom I'm *way* into -- as their standard for their own roasted, I'm damn happy they've found their way into the FiDi. The Baristas are attentive and massively kind. Surrounded by the monoliths of the coffee world -- along with the Hong Kong embassy across the street -- it's this locally owned & roasted shop that keeps it real around here.
author: Jon A.

description: Contemporary place to go to, great location in downtown San Francisco.  Got the hand crafted Guatemala mix, perfect blend to start off the morning.  A bit overpriced but can't complain too much about it.
author: Kevin C.

description: Finally tried Coffee Bar today after passing by over a million times.  Best damn caramel latte I've ever had.  Cant wait try the Havana next.  Thumbs up to my new fav caffeine spot.
author: Lauren S.

description: The iced caramel Americano is to die for! The staff was friendly and relatively fast!
author: Mackenzie L.

description: Worse than the office coffee which is brewed Peet's. Had to wait with only 2 in front for 10 minutes on top of repeating my order a few times. Yes, still need my coffee.
author: Sharon M.

description:
So much love for the Coffee Bar.

I was bouncing around different places to find a satisfactory cup of morning coffee (Petes, then Coffee Bean), with no real satisfaction. And it always seemed like a dicey experience... slipping them one of my java jackets as they rush through coffee orders. I knew they didn't really get why I re-use them (the planet, people!), but they obliged me anyways. And the coffee was alright.

Then, on my way to Coffee Bean this morning, coming from Market, a diversion from my usual routine - I find Coffee Bar! And sure, I'm a design whore so it lures my in with its clean white walls and simple and modern signage. Coffee tastes amazingly smooth - finally! Not too acidic, not too weak. Just perfect.

And, the lady at the counter totally got my reusing of java jackets. She even took off the additional paper cup herself to put on my java jacket, which was resting on the counter before I had a chance to mention it! And then suggested that they have designer ones I can buy online on eBay (that might be a taking the whole design thing too far, even for me). Oh, and the chocolate amman - to die for. Crunchy and caramelly around the sides, flaky and buttery in the middle - with chocolately bites in between.

Lovely. Just lovely. Will be back in the morning :)
author: Christel L.

description: Love this place! Perfect as a stop on your way to work.  It was probably one of the best Vanilla Latte's I've had in awhile.  Looking forward to stoping there everytime I'm in SF!
author: Ngoc N.

description: I was initially doubtful when I saw the server pouring pre-made Vietnamese coffee into my plastic cup. But boy was it good. It wasn't too sweet and tasted surprisingly fresh. Yum
author: Jason T.

description: That first cup of coffee of a morning holds promise. Lots of promise. I'd put a lot of hope into Coffee Bar but unfortunately it just never got there for me. The promise is there: cool branding, great location, range of coffee contraptions, knowledge of the beans, juices, salads and a line out the door (don't worry it moves quickly). We're spoilt for coffee in Australia, and although I can't rave endlessly about this coffee, it was the one cup of joe that gave me a consistent brew whilst in this part of San Francisco.
author: Lani P.

description:
It's getting there. Not sure if the double entendre is intended, but the Coffee Bar didn't quite meet my bar for premium coffee in SF. I absolutely love the idea of it all - responsibly sourced beans, one-cup-at-a-time mentality, local pastries plus healthy options like Strauss yogurt and gourmet granola. But the coffee itself didn't seem rich or fragrant enough, and the temperature of my espresso drinks was lukewarm. I tried the caramel latte that everyone raved about and thought it was a tad too sweet. Pastries were a miss too; the kouign amann I had tasted dry and stale.

The baristas are all very nice (and good-looking at that) and I think with some tweaks and time this place could be a real contender.
author: Claire C.

description:
They make both corrados and Vietnamese ice coffee. I think I'm in coffee heaven. My cortado was delicious. Can't speak to the ice coffee yet, but update to come.

Nice people too :)
author: H B.

description: Jeannette remembered my name and treated me like gold.  Everyone is friendly, efficient and kick ass.  Thank you!
author: W. S.

description:
AMAZING coffee, delicious to-go food items, and stellar customer service.

I recently had a mix-up related to a gift card purchase that left me a bit disappointed to say the least. The Coffee Bar team suggested I write an email to their corporate team, who replied promptly and more than rectified the issue for me and my gift card recipients.

Needless to say, I'll be Coffee Bar customer for life.
author: Danielle R.

description:
Good Stuff...but pricey

Espresso drinks come with a nice layer of creme..mmm! Coffeebeans perfectly roasted they make some awesome latte's and cappucino's- Mild taste, no bitter aftertaste- see that''s great stuff!

Negative: Pricey! Medium Latte and afternoon cookie will set u back about 10 bucks...recession? what recession? ;-)
author: Achraf S.

description:
This is JUST based on a pastry experience.

I though I'd give one of their pastries a try and for $3 got a cheddar/scallion scone on recommendation of the barista. This thing somehow manages to be greasy, tasteless and dry. 

On another note they have a beautiful setup, friendly staff and I'm hoping for really good things for these guys- maybe just a couple recipe tweaks.
author: Margot K.

description:
Complete fail.

They used to give out loyalty cards. I filled one up and brought it in. They didn't honor it as "they no longer do loyalty cards."

Luckily plenty better coffee nearby!
author: Chi N.

description:
This is usually my go-to for morning coffee. I'm not the biggest fan of the taste of coffee but I'm also not a fan of the cups of sugar that Starbucks serves. Coffee Bar is a happy medium for me. I love the mocha, lattes, cafe au lait, and even the Vietnamese iced coffee. The Vietnamese iced coffee really gets me moving when I need it the most!

My one complaint is that sometimes it seems like it takes forever for the baristas to prepare the drinks - I've waited at least 10 minutes for a drink multiple times when it hasn't seemed to be very crazy in there and that gets to be frustrating. Regardless, I keep going back...
author: Mary B.

description: Best coffee in the FiDi!  Stop giving your money to chain shops, will ya?
author: Jim F.

description: Your cortado is a gift from the god's of coffee. Perfect balance of espresso, milk and froth. No sugar needed.
author: Dan P.

description: Best decision I have made so far today!  Yummy yummy delicious coffee.  Organic Strauss plain yogurt with my choice of toppings.  Good croissant.  Perfect breakfast on a business trip.  I feel caffeinated, healthy, and indulged.  I will be back tomorrow!
author: D B.

description: ALL you really have to know is that the Havana latte is to die for!!! HMM It's so good and super creamy!
author: Nathalie B.

description:
This is my choice for straight-up espresso when I need a little sumthin sumthin in the afternoon.

They do a nicely-pulled shot in a real ceramic cup, and serve it with a little glass of water without asking. Stand-up tables at the window. It's all very Euro and oh so civilized.

I find their other coffee drinks to be fine, but not necessarily better than other places in town. Baked goods are tasty too. The whole thing is a little pricey and pretentious (which of course is the case with all the high-end coffee joints in SF) but it's quite pleasant and it's a carefully-made drink. The espresso is ground, weighed, and brewed with skill. Not fast like Starbux but not crazy-slow like Blue Bottle, where they stop and calibrate the machine for like 30 minutes right before it's your turn in line.

If you enjoy a good coffee or espresso drink you should try their stuff and see how it stacks up to your favorite. It's worth a visit for sure.
author: Al M.

description: I like this place for their fancy drips and the havana latte with condensed milk. The coffee here has good flavor and is strong! The only thing I've had which I didn't like was the mocha. It's wasn't as rich as I'd hoped. Aside from coffee you can also get juice, yogurt, pastries, salads, and sandwiches. The staff is always very friendly and happy to explain anything on the menu.
author: Alice J.

description: Stubbled on to this little gem of a coffee place as it was just around the corner of my office. First I had the Cortado and it was delicious especially when your're going brain dead in the afternoon, it gives you the kick you need to keep you going. I just love their Havana Latte just yummy in the morning. The wait can be a bit long but worth it, if you really enjoy a good cup of coffee and service of course.
author: Shirley P.

description: The good: nice staff.  The bad: very crowded, poorly organized interior, and most importantly -- weak coffee!  I prefer the dark roast at Noah's.  I go here for the scones, which are fabulous.
author: Harry P.

description: An awesome coffee spot in SF!  They make a great cappuccino, though it is a bit weak.  As them to add an extra shot to the 8 oz and it will be perfection!
author: David S.

description: Lots of people here every morning. I finally stop in and what do I get? A slightly too salty quinoa salad, of course!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Surprisingly good coffee in the FiDi. In my opinion, comparable to blue bottle.

Loses one star due to the all idiots walking between the two of us sitting outside, inside taking the few to go around....
author: Mark S.

description: Awesome coffee though I was sorta bummed when I met a colleague here on my first visit.  There really isn't a place to sit down.  I had mistakenly thought it would be like the Coffee Bar in Potrero which is very spacious and has many chair, tables, and couches.  Coffee Bar on Montgomery is practically a take out place - not a place to hang out.  Still... the coffee is great!  Worth it.
author: Jeff M.

description: It took me three days to figure out that the 'USA' they wrote on my cup meant that I had ordered an Americano.
author: Lamb Shanks S.

description:
I don't know what the heck the craze is about here. Surely their tip jar is filled to the brim with bills but ironically, they can't even make a decent cup of coffee.

Came here during my lunch break to order their Viet iced coffee. Hey, they have it on the menu so don't look at me like I'm the weirdo.

If you haven't read my other reviews, I am a huge Viet coffee fein and nothing dissapoints me more than not finding places in the FIDI that serve Viet coffee; let alone, good Viet coffee.

I don't have the time to hike up 2 miles just to get to Chinatown from Market St to get myself a cup of Viet coffee. But after having one of the worst and most water downed, not Viet-tasting coffee here, I'd take back my offer and rather hike that 2 miles to get myself a decent brew.

Other huge disappointment- there were food flies hoovering over their pastries and cookies. No thank you!!
author: Keiko C.

description: The Guatemala pour-over is a bad joke today. Maybe it's stale beans, maybe it's the guy that made it, but this is truly terrible coffee: it's bitter through and through. This is definitely no Sightglass or Four Barrel-class cup of pour-over, and even Blue Bottle at the Ferry Building or 5th St on the most busy days does a much better job than this. Go get a cup at Special Xtra (they have Blue Bottle beans, and generally use Three Africans for their drip) to save yourself a cup full of regret.
author: Christopher B.

description: Coffee Bar thinks very high of itself.  However, I have a couple of things to say.  First, the espresso drinks are very bland.  So I am giviing up and going to somewhere else.  I tried many different kinds of drinks here.  They do not use organic milk - which I think matters a lot in latte.  This is not like FourBarrels.
author: Edward L.

description: I've only ever had the specialty mocha here and I'm in love. I can't wait to try the other mocha and some of the other drinks as they all look delicious.
author: Shauna S.

description: Nice strong regular coffee. Really dark and rich. Caramel latte was pretty good, lovely foam art, but a bit one note. Not the best I've had. Nice to have an outpost in the fidi.
author: E. W.

description:
I had a great cappuccino at the new Coffee Bar-- rich espresso with just the right amount of milk/foam. 

After years of the chains, kinda nice to have a serious coffee house in the FiDi.
author: Mark G.

description:
Excellent cappuccino.  Much better than Starbuck's or Peet's.  Great pastries too.  

Totally nice to have non-chain good coffee in the hood.
author: raquel d.

description: This great coffee shop makes my way to work so much more enjoyable! They have super friendly staff, serve the coffee incredibly fast and above all, the espresso is just incredibly good!
author: Marcello S.

description:
Love it!  Great way to start my day with an au lait.  I am always expecting a huge line but they move pretty fast.  I tried the kouign amann becuase there seemed to be some buzz about it.  It was like a very sticky, donut-y croissant.  I think I'll pass next time, but if you like sticky donut-croissant hybrids you might like it.  That probably isn't a reflection on Coffee Bar, though, becuase I doubt they make their own pastries.  

The staff here are really nice and not snobbish at all, like some coffee joints can be.  New coffee spot for those who can't brew their own coffee at work to save their life.
author: Alison K.

description: I love coffee bar. It's my go to coffee place in sf when I'm working downtown. There's quite a few coffee spots near this location: Peets, Coffee Bean, and Starbucks. The quality and service you get at Coffee Bar is unmatched. I always order the Havana Latte and when I'm feeling extra decadent, a Kouign Amann. It's like heaven every time you take a bite our of that buttery, sugary, flaky piece of pastry. Absolutely amazing. The icing on the cake: their latte art. It makes me smile whenever I get a heart with my latte.
author: Heather S.

description:
I have worked downtown for several years and Peet's was my old stand by, but now I'm very happy to have a good coffee bar to go to. They make a delicious drip and cappuccino (the ones I've tried so far).

They use good strong beans and make each cup separately, which makes a fresh and very rich cup of coffee--the mainstream coffee shops don't do this and you can taste the difference. Also the foam/milk used in my cappuccino was dense and very creamy (yum!)

I also appreciate their attention to being a more sustainable business, producing less plastic and paper waste. 

The staff was friendly and seem to know their trade well.
author: Andy C.

description:
Delicious coffee, staff was really friendly, long wasn't long.

**Edit**
Went there again this morning, realized that they have soy milk at the milk/lid/other stuff station! They also have brown sugar! I rarely see a coffee place that has brown sugar. Also, Starbucks charges $0.60 to add soy, while Coffee Bar freely offers it. I like Coffee Bar even more now, so I added another star.
author: Melissa P.

description: Great balance between a quick coffee shop and excellent quality coffee, which is hard to find! They have a simple menu of espresso drinks and pour over coffee, and all are expertly prepared. Very good selection of local baked goods. I am not a scone person, but I have a hard time saying no to their maple bacon and parsley cheddar scones. The yogurt cups with toppings are also a great breakfast option when I'm running late. And I really appreciate they have a self serve drip coffee option for just $2! Don't come here expecting to sit down for a leisurely cup (there is no room), but definitely come here if you're looking for a to-go beverage!
author: Alison S.

description: I think Coffee Bar definitely makes my favorite espressos anywhere in the city. The beans they use are always perfectly balanced: extremely smooth with no sour/bitterness and a hint of roasty-toasty toffee notes. All too often I've had a straight up espresso and have been disappointed. Their lattes are great too and they use really good chocolate for their mochas (bonus you can request dark or milk chocolate). Everyone who works here is also super nice and in spite of always being mobbed I've pretty much always found a seat outside and my order has never been messed up. They are definitely doing something right!
author: Steven H.

description: YES - great coffee next to work! best latte in a square mile
author: nick g.

description: First of all, the lattes are really good, and I've had the blue cheese hazelnut salad for lunch and that was really good too. Also, the morning buns rival La Farine. But the best is the chai. I'm a chai expert and since Citizen Cale no longer does their chai, this is my new chai. It is subtle, laced with cardamon, but not overpowering; sophisticated, yet simple. I've worked downtown for 20 years, and can't believe we finally have a decent coffee place, hurray!
author: Renee R.

description: so EXPENSIVE.  I suppose I'm not a natural member of the Fidi because the prices always raise my eyebrows slightly, but what the hey, you're worth it.  Chai is no good here though.  The flavors aren't blended so everything tastes distinct and you end up drinking oddly flavored milky water grit.  However, I do like to treat myself with the Haviana Latte and the kougin amman from Starter Bakery.  The kougin amman is buttery and fruity and as delicious as I always thought it would be.  However, a $4 price means it retains that just out of reach quality that makes it such a treat.
author: Andrea L.

description: Love this place.  It is a welcome addition to the Financial District.  I'm a daily visitor and the espresso is always just right.  Having local merchants who take their craft seriously is awesome!   The location and staff are great and they take pride in pouring you a great cup of joe!
author: Jason H.

description:
I love the Coffee Bar!  Was already a fan of their Bryant Street location and now even better-close to work.  Have been twice in two days.  Excellent third wave coffee and the dark roast is so good they can't keep the beans on the shelf, but you can't make it at home quite the way they do there.  

Bright, clean, spare design and still inviting and friendly with a truly welcoming staff.  Maybe they will start serving beer and wine in the evening like Bryant Street and then I will have to stop there on the way home as well.....
author: Jennifer C.

description: I never yelp. but I HAD TO SHARE THIS WITH YOU ALL....I just bought some beans. And the "Best By" date said 4/30/13. When I got back to the office, I noticed there was whiteout on the date. No way they just whited out an old batch and just re-dated it right? Well, I scratched off the whiteout and it had a date of 4/6/13!!! The same date of bags I have seen since March!! That is shady! I called them to ask, and the lady said it could be that the roaster didn't have enough bags and just reused them. I call BS!!!! Their bags don't look like they can be easily resealed without any damage when opening. I will never spend another cent at this BS place.
author: DT l.

description: Best place to get a latte, mocha, and pastry in the FiDi. If you appreciate handcrafted drinks and want a change from Starbucks, you must go here. I have to confess I'm addicted to their Havana Latte. Ever since I've had it I have not gone anywhere else. It's delicious but maybe a bit sweet for some people. They add a tablespoon of condensed milk so no need to add sugar or sweetener. I like that. Unfortunately, there are no seats inside but they do have a couple of tables outside. If you're in the Potrero Hill area stop by their original location.
author: Eileen B.

description:
I wanted to try something new today and ordered the "Havana Latte" which, as I was told, is latte with a "little bit" of condensed milk. It is a bit pricey ($4.50 for a large cup) for how much you get. I brought in my own cup (size of a grande in  Starbucks) and it was filled less than 70%). I asked for less ice but I don't think my request was passed on to the barista by the cashier.

I was surprised by the taste of latte. You can definitely taste the goodness of a handmade latte! It is not bland and I like the addition of condensed milk to its taste. However, the they probably put twice the amount that they should. I filled my cup (the other 30%) with milk but it was still too sweet for me too finish the entire cup. I would return to try the other lattes on their menu.
author: S H.

description: Good coffee and hard-boiled eggs (healthy!) but they stop doing pour-overs at 4pm (bait and switch!) in theory because it gets too busy. If you want a pour over and it's getting close to 4pm, go across the street to Workshop Cafe.
author: Naval R.

description: There are so many coffee places on this block, how does a girl choose. All this time, I've stuck with the norm - Peet's and Starbucks. But this place is a gem. My friend insisted I had to try the Havana latte and I enjoyed it immensely. It's on the sweet side and the coffee had a really good flavor. It was about $4 but well worth it. It's so smooth going down and there's definitely excitement for the next cup.
author: Candace F.

description:
I go there for lunch quite often and really like the food. Whether you get the grab-n-go sandwiches or order what's on special, you won't be disappointed.  Excellent quality all the time. 

Their prosciutto sandwich is my favorite.  Their tuna salad sandwich is also very good - and very different than what you get at most other places.  I've tried a couple of soups as well and have been very happy.  

Apparently their Turkey sandwich is the most popular. Tried it once. Not bad but not something that I would order again.
author: Nick K.

description: Good coffee, but $4.50 (plus extra for toppings) for an 8 oz. yogurt is absurd!
author: Shannon W.

description: Staff here be hella friendly! Smilin faces n errrthanng. Cafe real clean n fancy! The cream art they be addin on them lattes is what I came fo! No disappointment at all baby. Caramel latte taste all good! Will come back that's fo show
author: Lynn K.

description: Yes, the Havana latte is that good.  Love the surprisingly comfy little seats on the sidewalk.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Delish coffee.  Organic yogurt and toppings.  Love this place!
author: Denise K.

description: Based on just the latte - creamy texture, smooth and not acidic! yay!!
author: carissa s.

description: I absolutely love the Coffee Bar! No frills. It seems like they are all about the coffee, which is the best I have had in SF. Any time I get the chance, I stop by this place. I can't speak for every drink they serve but the espresso is just outstanding. The Americano they serve is smooth without even a trace of bitterness. The lines can be long but it's well worth the wait to start your day with an incredible cup of coffee.
author: Bill C.

description: Best coffee in SF so far!!! It was bliss in each sip :)
author: Julie M.

description: Coffee Bar is clean and simple. They feature two La Marzocco Strata machines, a beautiful addition to any shop. The staff was positive and enthusiastic which is always a nice way to be greeted. My & a friends espresso tasted a touch overextracted (bitter), one of their baristas came outside to introduce himself; he recognized the BGA on my jacket. We had met at a Coffee Fest in San Diego earlier in the year. I would return for another pull from him. It was a pleasure, at the least, reacquainting w a fellow barista.
author: Jamie R.

description: Best cappucino I've had in the city (excellent lattes too!).  I'm in love and have been buying their beans ever since I stepped into this coffee nirvana.
author: Mala K.

description: This place takes "handcrafted" to an extreme.  Caught the barista "tamping" coffee with his bare fingers before using a tamper.  Gross!  Looks like he kept doing this for every shot he pulled.  And for all the fanfare of serving coffee with a glass of water, the taste was an anticlimax (over brewed) compared to other  serious places like illy espressamente (a few blocksdown).
author: P H.

description: This place makes excellent coffee, but also employs people who are a pleasure to see every day. If you go, order the Havana Latte. Because, life is short.
author: D Z.

description: This is the new gold standard for a FiDi macchiato, bumping that Illy stand near the Sutter Gutter. The chaser of mineral water gets the 5th star. Order it in ceramic (of course), it's about as good as coffee can get!
author: T B.

description: Its about time we got a higher quality coffee spot in this area.  Bright, clean atmosphere.  Friendly baristas.  Great coffee.
author: Green B.

description: pretty good cappuccino.. kept me awake all day at work on friday! i shall return.
author: Summer R.

description: Got 2 grab and go sandwiches only to find out they were mislabeled. They also had 1 thin slice of meat and mayo for $6 ea.  What a joke!
author: Karma Is Coming 4 U.

description: This is almost like being in Italy.  It's definitely the best coffee in our neighborhood....our new favorite, especially if they start opening on Saturdays!
author: Ann T.

description: The only downside to this tiny place is it tends to be a little crowded. There's a good reason why: the staff is always friendly and their coffee is consistently terrific. From the simple to the most basic concoction - terrific. If you're in the financial district it's definitely worth walking a few extra blocks for coffee prepared with tender loving care.
author: Clay W.

description: Great coffee and pastries. My regular morning stop.
author: Cate M. Z.

description: Love everything about it!!! The coffee is superb and the decor is perfect and the staff remarkably well-informed and helpful.  I can't wait to go back!!!!
author: Sue B.

description: Surprisingly their brunch food was very decent. I didn't expect that from a coffee place. Poached eggs w home fries / hash had a great hollandaise sauce. My secret brunch place when the popular places have lines around the block.
author: Christina C.

description: Thought I'd try out the new place on the block.  Latte was fine, but nearly a dollar more than Peet's in the next block.  Staff were not particulary friendly either.  Looks like I'll be sticking with my old stand-by!
author: John D.

description: Found this place as the result of searching for my favorite Bakhti chai, which they serve. Unfortunately, the goodness ends there. The store was chaotic... the layout is weird. And the "condiments" bar (sugar, cinnamon, etc.) was messy and not well labeled. Also: expensive. AND my drink wasn't even really hot....
author: Adam K.

description: Absolutely amazing! i am here every morning before heading into the office. Bye bye Starbucks!
author: Christie S.

description: This place is a joke.  Great concept and nice space but it takes 10 minutes to make a drink simply because they have to put a pretty "leaf" design on it.  The coffee is way too weak and when you ask them to fix a drink the way you want it, they charge you more.  I'll stick with Martha Brothers or Pete's from now on.
author: Laura G.
